   20: -module(global_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: %% Prior to OTP 26, maybe_expr used to require runtime support. As it's now
   23: %% enabled by default, all modules are tagged with the feature even when they
   24: %% don't use it. Therefore, we explicitly disable it until OTP 25 is out of
   25: %% support.
   26: -feature(maybe_expr, disable).
   27: -compile(r25). % many_nodes()
   28: 
   29: -export([all/0, suite/0, groups/0, 
   30: 	 init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   31:          init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   32:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2,
   33: 
   34: 	 names/1, names_hidden/1, locks/1, locks_hidden/1,
   35: 	 bad_input/1, names_and_locks/1, lock_die/1, name_die/1,
   36: 	 basic_partition/1, basic_name_partition/1,
   37: 	 advanced_partition/1, stress_partition/1,
   38: 	 ring/1, simple_ring/1, line/1, simple_line/1,
   39: 	 global_lost_nodes/1, otp_1849/1,
   40: 	 otp_3162/1, otp_5640/1, otp_5737/1,
   41:          connect_all_false/1, 
   42:          simple_disconnect/1, 
   43:          simple_resolve/1, simple_resolve2/1, simple_resolve3/1,
   44:          leftover_name/1, re_register_name/1, name_exit/1, external_nodes/1,
   45:          many_nodes/1, sync_0/1,
   46: 	 global_groups_change/1,
   47: 	 register_1/1,
   48: 	 both_known_1/1,
   49:          lost_unregister/1,
   50: 	 mass_death/1,
   51: 	 garbage_messages/1,
   52:          ring_line/1,
   53:          flaw1/1,
   54:          lost_connection/1,
   55:          lost_connection2/1,
   56:          global_disconnect/1
   57:         ]).
   58: 
   59: %% Not used
   60: -export([config_dc/4,
   61:          w/2,
   62:          check_same/2,
   63:          check_same/1,
   64:          stop/0,
   65:          start_nodes_serially/3]).
   66: 
   67: -export([lock_global/2, lock_global2/2]).
   68: 
   69: -export([
   70:          %% Called via ?RES
   71:          resolve_none/3,
   72:          resolve_first/3,
   73:          resolve_second/3,
   74:          bad_resolver/3,
   75:          badrpc_resolver/3,
   76:          lock_resolver/3,
   77:          exit_resolver/3,
   78:          disconnect_first/3,
   79:          halt_second/3,
   80:          init_mass_spawn/1,
   81: 
   82:          %% Called via rpc_cast
   83:          crash/1,
   84:          single_node/2,
   85:          alone/2,
   86:          global_load/3,
   87: 
   88:          %% Called via rpc:call
   89:          halt_node/1,
   90:          start_proc/0, start_proc/1,
   91:          start_proc2/1,
   92:          start_proc3/1,
   93:          start_proc4/1,
   94:          start_proc_basic/1,
   95:          start_resolver/2,
   96: 
   97:          %% Called as a fun (fun ?MODULE:function/x) 
   98:          fix_basic_name/3,
   99: 
  100:          %% Called via spawn
  101:          init_proc_basic/2,
  102:          init_2/0,
  103:          p_init/1, p_init/2,
  104:          p_init2/2
  105: 
  106:         ]).
  107: 
  108: -export([start_tracer/0, stop_tracer/0, get_trace/0]).
  109: 
  110: %% Exports for error_logger handler
  111: -export([init/1, handle_event/2, handle_info/2, handle_call/2, terminate/2]).
  112: 
  113: 
  114: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
  115: -include("kernel_test_lib.hrl").
  116: 
  117: -define(NODES, [node()|nodes()]).
  118: 
  119: -define(UNTIL(Seq), loop_until_true(fun() -> Seq end, Config, 1)).
  120: 
  121: %% The resource used by the global module.
  122: -define(GLOBAL_LOCK, global).
  123: 
  124: %% -define(DBG(T), erlang:display({{self(), ?MODULE, ?LINE, ?FUNCTION_NAME}, T})).
  125: 
  126: 
  127: suite() ->
  128:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
  129: 
  130: all() -> 
  131:     case init:get_argument(ring_line) of
  132: 	{ok, _} -> [ring_line];
  133: 	_ ->
  134: 	    [
  135:              names, names_hidden, locks, locks_hidden, bad_input,
  136: 	     names_and_locks, lock_die, name_die, basic_partition,
  137: 	     advanced_partition, basic_name_partition,
  138: 	     stress_partition, simple_ring, simple_line, ring, line,
  139: 	     global_lost_nodes, otp_1849, otp_3162, otp_5640,
  140: 	     otp_5737, connect_all_false, simple_disconnect, simple_resolve,
  141: 	     simple_resolve2, simple_resolve3, leftover_name,
  142: 	     re_register_name, name_exit, external_nodes, many_nodes,
  143: 	     sync_0, global_groups_change, register_1, both_known_1,
  144: 	     lost_unregister, mass_death, garbage_messages, flaw1,
  145:              lost_connection, lost_connection2, global_disconnect
  146:             ]
  147:     end.
  148: 
  149: groups() -> 
  150:     [{ttt, [],
  151:       [names, names_hidden, locks, locks_hidden, bad_input,
  152:        names_and_locks, lock_die, name_die, basic_partition,
  153:        ring]}].
  154: 
  155: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  156:     Config.
  157: 
  158: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  159:     Config.
  160: 
  161: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  162:     Config.
  163: 
  164: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
  165:     ok.
  166: 
  167: 
  168: -define(TESTCASE, testcase_name).
  169: -define(testcase, proplists:get_value(?TESTCASE, Config)).
  170: -define(nodes_tag, '$global_nodes').
  171: -define(registered, proplists:get_value(registered, Config)).
  172: 
  173: init_per_testcase(Case, Config0) when is_atom(Case) andalso is_list(Config0) ->
  174:     start_node_tracker(Config0),
  175: 
  176:     ?P("init_per_testcase -> entry with"
  177:        "~n   Config:   ~p"
  178:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  179:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  180:        "~n   Monitors: ~p",
  181:        [Config0, erlang:nodes(), pi(links), pi(monitors)]),
  182: 
  183:     ok = gen_server:call(global_name_server,
  184:                          high_level_trace_start,
  185:                          infinity),
  186: 
  187:     Config1 = [{?TESTCASE, Case}, {registered, registered()} | Config0],
  188: 
  189:     ?P("init_per_testcase -> done when"
  190:        "~n   Config:   ~p"
  191:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  192:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  193:        "~n   Monitors: ~p", [Config1, erlang:nodes(), pi(links), pi(monitors)]),
  194: 
  195:     Config1.
  196: 
  197: end_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
  198:     ?P("end_per_testcase -> entry with"
  199:        "~n   Config:   ~p"
  200:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  201:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  202:        "~n   Monitors: ~p",
  203:        [Config, erlang:nodes(), pi(links), pi(monitors)]),
  204: 
  205:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
  206:     _ = gen_server:call(global_name_server, high_level_trace_stop, infinity),
  207:     [global:unregister_name(N) || N <- global:registered_names()],
  208:     InitRegistered = ?registered,
  209:     Registered = registered(),
  210: 
  211:     [?P("end_per_testcase -> "
  212:         "~n   ~s local names: ~p", [What, N]) ||
  213: 	{What, N} <- [{"Added", Registered -- InitRegistered},
  214: 		      {"Removed", InitRegistered -- Registered}],
  215: 	N =/= []],
  216: 
  217:     ?P("end_per_testcase -> done with"
  218:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  219:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  220:        "~n   Monitors: ~p",
  221:        [erlang:nodes(), pi(links), pi(monitors)]),
  222: 
  223:     stop_node_tracker(Config). %% Needs to be last and produce return value...
  224: 
  225: %%% General comments:
  226: %%% One source of problems with failing tests can be that the nodes from the
  227: %%% previous test haven't died yet.
  228: %%% So, when stressing a particular test by running it in a loop, it may
  229: %%% fail already when starting the help nodes, even if the nodes have been
  230: %%% monitored and the nodedowns picked up at the previous round. Waiting
  231: %%% a few seconds between rounds seems to solve the problem. Possibly the
  232: %%% timeout of 7 seconds for connections can also be a problem. This problem
  233: %%% is the same with old (vsn 3) and new global (vsn 4).
  234: 
  235: 
  236: %%% Test that register_name/2 registers the name on all nodes, even if
  237: %%% a new node appears in the middle of the operation (OTP-3552).
  238: %%%
  239: %%% Test scenario: process p2 is spawned, locks global, starts a slave node,
  240: %%% and tells the parent to do register_name. Then p2 sleeps for five seconds
  241: %%% and releases the lock. Now the name should exist on both our own node
  242: %%% and on the slave node (we wait until that is true; it seems that we
  243: %%% can do rpc calls to another node before the connection is really up).
  244: register_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  245:     Timeout = 15,
  246:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
  247:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
  248:     init_condition(Config),
  249:     P = spawn_link(?MODULE, lock_global, [self(), Config]),
  250:     receive
  251: 	{P, ok} ->
  252: 	    io:format("p1: received ok~n"),
  253: 	    ok
  254:     end,
  255:     P ! step2,
  256:     io:format("p1: sent step2~n"),
  257:     yes = global:register_name(foo, self()),
  258:     io:format("p1: registered~n"),
  259:     P ! step3,
  260:     receive
  261: 	{P, I, I2} ->
  262: 	    ok
  263:     end,
  264:     if
  265: 	I =:= I2 ->
  266: 	    ok;
  267: 	true ->
  268: 	    ct:fail({notsync, I, I2})
  269:     end,
  270:     _ = global:unregister_name(foo),
  271:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
  272:     init_condition(Config),
  273:     ok.
  274: 
  275: lock_global(Parent, Config) ->
  276:     Id = {global, self()},
  277:     io:format("p2: setting lock~n"),
  278:     global:set_lock(Id, [node()]),
  279:     Parent ! {self(), ok},
  280:     io:format("p2: sent ok~n"),
  281:     receive
  282: 	step2 ->
  283: 	    io:format("p2: received step2"),
  284: 	    ok
  285:     end,
  286:     io:format("p2: starting slave~n"),
  287:     {ok, Host} = inet:gethostname(),
  288:     {ok, N1} = slave:start(Host, node1),
  289:     io:format("p2: deleting lock~n"),
  290:     global:del_lock(Id, [node()]),
  291:     io:format("p2: deleted lock~n"),
  292:     receive
  293: 	step3 ->
  294: 	    ok
  295:     end,
  296:     io:format("p2: received step3~n"),
  297:     I = global:whereis_name(foo),
  298:     io:format("p2: name ~p~n", [I]),
  299:     ?UNTIL(I =:= rpc:call(N1, global, whereis_name, [foo])),
  300:     I2 = I,
  301:     slave:stop(N1),
  302:     io:format("p2: name2 ~p~n", [I2]),
  303:     Parent ! {self(), I, I2},
  304:     ok.
  305: 
  306: %%% Test for the OTP-3576 problem: if nodes 1 and 2 are separated and
  307: %%% brought together again, while keeping connection with 3, it could
  308: %%% happen that if someone temporarily held the 'global' lock,
  309: %%% 'try_again_locker' would be called, and this time cause both 1 and 2
  310: %%% to obtain a lock for 'global' on node 3, which would keep the
  311: %%% name registry from ever becoming consistent again.
  312: both_known_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  313:     case prevent_overlapping_partitions() of
  314:         true ->
  315:             {skipped, "Prevent overlapping partitions enabled"};
  316:         false ->
  317:             both_known_1_test(Config)
  318:     end.
  319: 
  320: both_known_1_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  321:     Timeout = 30,
  322:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
  323:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
  324:     init_condition(Config),
  325: 
  326:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
  327: 
  328:     [Cp1, Cp2, Cp3] = start_nodes([cp1, cp2, cp3], slave, Config),
  329: 
  330:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
  331: 
  332:     rpc_disconnect_node(Cp1, Cp2, Config),
  333: 
  334:     {_Pid1, yes} = rpc:call(Cp1, ?MODULE, start_proc, [p1]),
  335:     {_Pid2, yes} = rpc:call(Cp2, ?MODULE, start_proc, [p2]),
  336: 
  337:     Names10 = rpc:call(Cp1, global, registered_names, []),
  338:     Names20 = rpc:call(Cp2, global, registered_names, []),
  339:     Names30 = rpc:call(Cp3, global, registered_names, []),
  340: 
  341:     Names1 = Names10 -- OrigNames,
  342:     Names2 = Names20 -- OrigNames,
  343:     Names3 = Names30 -- OrigNames,
  344: 
  345:     [p1] = lists:sort(Names1),
  346:     [p2] = lists:sort(Names2),
  347:     [p1, p2] = lists:sort(Names3),
  348: 
  349:     Locker = spawn(Cp3, ?MODULE, lock_global2, [{global, l3},
  350: 						self()]),
  351: 
  352:     receive
  353: 	{locked, S} ->
  354: 	    true = S
  355:     end,
  356: 
  357:     pong = rpc:call(Cp1, net_adm, ping, [Cp2]),
  358: 
  359:     %% Bring cp1 and cp2 together, while someone has locked global.
  360:     %% They will now loop in 'loop_locker'.
  361: 
  362:     Names10_2 = rpc:call(Cp1, global, registered_names, []),
  363:     Names20_2 = rpc:call(Cp2, global, registered_names, []),
  364:     Names30_2 = rpc:call(Cp3, global, registered_names, []),
  365: 
  366:     Names1_2 = Names10_2 -- OrigNames,
  367:     Names2_2 = Names20_2 -- OrigNames,
  368:     Names3_2 = Names30_2 -- OrigNames,
  369: 
  370:     [p1] = lists:sort(Names1_2),
  371:     [p2] = lists:sort(Names2_2),
  372:     [p1, p2] = lists:sort(Names3_2),
  373: 
  374:     %% Let go of the lock, and expect the lockers to resolve the name
  375:     %% registry.
  376:     Locker ! {ok, self()},
  377: 
  378:     ?UNTIL(begin
  379: 	       Names10_3 = rpc:call(Cp1, global, registered_names, []),
  380: 	       Names20_3 = rpc:call(Cp2, global, registered_names, []),
  381: 	       Names30_3 = rpc:call(Cp3, global, registered_names, []),
  382: 
  383: 	       Names1_3 = Names10_3 -- OrigNames,
  384: 	       Names2_3 = Names20_3 -- OrigNames,
  385: 	       Names3_3 = Names30_3 -- OrigNames,
  386: 
  387: 	       N1 = lists:sort(Names1_3),
  388: 	       N2 = lists:sort(Names2_3),
  389: 	       N3 = lists:sort(Names3_3),
  390: 	       (N1 =:= [p1, p2]) and (N2 =:= [p1, p2]) and (N3 =:= [p1, p2])
  391: 	   end),
  392: 
  393:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
  394:     stop_node(Cp1),
  395:     stop_node(Cp2),
  396:     stop_node(Cp3),
  397: 
  398:     init_condition(Config),
  399:     ok.
  400: 
  401: %% OTP-6428. An unregistered name reappears.
  402: lost_unregister(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  403:     case prevent_overlapping_partitions() of
  404:         true ->
  405:             {skipped, "Prevent overlapping partitions enabled"};
  406:         false ->
  407:             lost_unregister_test(Config)
  408:     end.
  409: 
  410: lost_unregister_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  411:     Timeout = 30,
  412:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
  413:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
  414:     init_condition(Config),
  415: 
  416:     {ok, B} = start_node(b, Config),
  417:     {ok, C} = start_node(c, Config),
  418:     Nodes = [node(), B, C],
  419: 
  420:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
  421: 
  422:     %% start a proc and register it
  423:     {Pid, yes} = start_proc(test),
  424: 
  425:     ?UNTIL(Pid =:= global:whereis_name(test)),
  426:     check_everywhere(Nodes, test, Config),
  427: 
  428:     rpc_disconnect_node(B, C, Config),
  429:     check_everywhere(Nodes, test, Config),
  430:     _ = rpc:call(B, global, unregister_name, [test]),
  431:     ?UNTIL(undefined =:= global:whereis_name(test)),
  432:     Pid = rpc:call(C, global, whereis_name, [test]),
  433:     check_everywhere(Nodes--[C], test, Config),
  434:     pong = rpc:call(B, net_adm, ping, [C]),
  435: 
  436:     %% Now the name has reappeared on node B.
  437:     ?UNTIL(Pid =:= global:whereis_name(test)),
  438:     check_everywhere(Nodes, test, Config),
  439: 
  440:     exit_p(Pid),
  441: 
  442:     ?UNTIL(undefined =:= global:whereis_name(test)),
  443:     check_everywhere(Nodes, test, Config),
  444: 
  445:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
  446:     stop_node(B),
  447:     stop_node(C),
  448:     init_condition(Config),
  449:     ok.
  450: 
  451: lost_connection(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  452:     case prevent_overlapping_partitions() of
  453:         true ->
  454:             lost_connection_test(Config);
  455:         false ->
  456:             {skipped, "Prevent overlapping partitions disabled"}
  457:     end.
  458: 
  459: lost_connection_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  460:     %% OTP-17843: Registered names could become inconsistent due to
  461:     %%            overlapping partitions. This has been solved by
  462:     %%            global actively disconnecting nodes to prevent
  463:     %%            overlapping partitions.
  464:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 15}),
  465: 
  466:     [Cp1, Cp2] = start_nodes([cp1, cp2], peer, Config),
  467: 
  468:     PartCtrlr = setup_partitions(Config, [[node(), Cp1, Cp2]]),
  469: 
  470:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
  471: 
  472:     {Gurka, yes} = start_proc_basic(gurka),
  473: 
  474:     check_everywhere([node(), Cp1, Cp2], gurka, Config),
  475: 
  476:     Gurka = global:whereis_name(gurka),
  477: 
  478:     erlang:disconnect_node(Cp2), %% lost connection previously causing issues...
  479: 
  480:     erpc:call(
  481:       PartCtrlr,
  482:       fun () ->
  483:               erpc:call(
  484:                 Cp2,
  485:                 fun () ->
  486:                         {AltGurka, yes} = start_proc_basic(gurka),
  487:                         AltGurka = global:whereis_name(gurka)
  488:                 end),
  489:               timer:sleep(1000),
  490:               erpc:cast(Cp2, erlang, halt, []),
  491:               wait_until(fun () -> not lists:member(Cp2, nodes(hidden)) end)
  492:       end),
  493: 
  494:     Reconnected = case lists:member(Cp1, nodes()) of
  495:                       true ->
  496:                           false;
  497:                       false ->
  498:                           erlang:display("reconnecting Cp1"),
  499:                           pong = net_adm:ping(Cp1),
  500:                           timer:sleep(500),
  501:                           true
  502:                   end,
  503:     
  504:     check_everywhere([node(), Cp1], gurka, Config),
  505: 
  506:     Gurka = global:whereis_name(gurka),
  507: 
  508:     ok = global:unregister_name(gurka),
  509: 
  510:     stop_node(Cp1),
  511:     stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr),
  512: 
  513:     {comment, case Reconnected of
  514:                   true -> "Re-connected Cp1";
  515:                   false -> "No re-connection of Cp1 needed"
  516:               end}.
  517: 
  518: lost_connection2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  519:     case prevent_overlapping_partitions() of
  520:         true ->
  521:             lost_connection2_test(Config);
  522:         false ->
  523:             {skipped, "Prevent overlapping partitions disabled"}
  524:     end.
  525: 
  526: lost_connection2_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  527:     %% OTP-17843: Registered names could become inconsistent due to
  528:     %%            overlapping partitions. This has been solved by
  529:     %%            global actively disconnecting nodes to prevent
  530:     %%            overlapping partitions.
  531:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 15}),
  532: 
  533:     [Cp1, Cp2, Cp3, Cp4] = start_nodes([cp1, cp2, cp3, cp4], peer, Config),
  534: 
  535:     PartCtrlr = setup_partitions(Config, [[node(), Cp1, Cp2, Cp3, Cp4]]),
  536: 
  537:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
  538: 
  539:     {Gurka, yes} = start_proc_basic(gurka),
  540: 
  541:     check_everywhere([node(), Cp1, Cp2], gurka, Config),
  542: 
  543:     Gurka = global:whereis_name(gurka),
  544: 
  545:     disconnect_nodes(PartCtrlr, Cp3, Cp4),
  546: 
  547:     Nodes = nodes(),
  548:     true = lists:member(Cp1, Nodes),
  549:     true = lists:member(Cp2, Nodes),
  550:     false = lists:member(Cp3, Nodes),
  551:     false = lists:member(Cp4, Nodes),
  552: 
  553:     pong = net_adm:ping(Cp3),
  554:     pong = net_adm:ping(Cp4),
  555: 
  556:     stop_node(Cp1),
  557:     stop_node(Cp2),
  558:     stop_node(Cp3),
  559:     stop_node(Cp4),
  560:     stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr),
  561: 
  562:     ok.
  563: 
  564: -define(UNTIL_LOOP, 300).
  565: 
  566: -define(end_tag, 'end at').
  567: 
  568: init_high_level_trace(Time) ->
  569:     Mul = try 
  570:               test_server:timetrap_scale_factor()
  571: 	  catch _:_ -> 1
  572:           end,
  573:     put(?end_tag, msec() + Time * Mul * 1000),
  574:     %% Assures that started nodes start the high level trace automatically.
  575:     ok = gen_server:call(global_name_server, high_level_trace_start,infinity),
  576:     os:putenv("GLOBAL_HIGH_LEVEL_TRACE", "TRUE"),
  577:     put(?nodes_tag, []).
  578: 
  579: loop_until_true(Fun, Config, N) ->
  580:     %% ?DBG([{n, N}]),
  581:     put(n, N),
  582:     case Fun() of
  583: 	true ->
  584: 	    true;
  585: 	_ ->
  586:             case get(?end_tag) of
  587:                 undefined ->
  588:                     timer:sleep(?UNTIL_LOOP),
  589:                     loop_until_true(Fun, Config, N+1);
  590:                 EndAt ->
  591:                     Left = EndAt - msec(),
  592:                     case Left < 6000 of
  593:                         true -> 
  594:                             write_high_level_trace(Config),
  595:                             Ref = make_ref(),
  596:                             receive Ref -> ok end;
  597:                         false ->
  598:                             timer:sleep(?UNTIL_LOOP),
  599:                             loop_until_true(Fun, Config, N+1)
  600:                     end
  601:             end
  602:     end.
  603: 
  604: write_high_level_trace(Config) ->
  605:     case erase(?nodes_tag) of
  606:         undefined -> 
  607:             ok;
  608:         Nodes0 -> 
  609:             Nodes = lists:usort([node() | Nodes0]),            
  610:             write_high_level_trace(Nodes, Config)
  611:     end.
  612: 
  613: write_high_level_trace(Nodes, Config) ->
  614:     When = erlang:timestamp(),
  615:     %% 'info' returns more than the trace, which is nice.
  616:     Data = [{Node, {info, rpc:call(Node, global, info, [])}} ||
  617:                Node <- Nodes],
  618:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  619:     DataFile = filename:join([Dir, lists:concat(["global_", ?testcase])]),
  620:     io:format("\n\nAnalyze high level trace like this:\n"),
  621:     io:format("global_trace:dd(~p, [{show_state, 0, 10}]). % 10 seconds\n",
  622:              [DataFile]),
  623:     file:write_file(DataFile, term_to_binary({high_level_trace, When, Data})).
  624: 
  625: lock_global2(Id, Parent) ->
  626:     S = global:set_lock(Id),
  627:     Parent ! {locked, S},
  628:     receive
  629: 	{ok, Parent} ->
  630: 	    ok
  631:     end.
  632: 
  633: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
  634: %% Test suite for global names and locks.
  635: %% Should be started in a CC view with:
  636: %% erl -sname XXX -rsh ctrsh where XX not in [cp1, cp2, cp3]
  637: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
  638: 
  639: %% cp1 - cp3 are started, and the name 'test' registered for a process on
  640: %% test_server. Then it is checked that the name is registered on all
  641: %% nodes, using whereis_name. Check that the same
  642: %% name can't be registered with another value. Exit the registered
  643: %% process and check that the name disappears. Register a new process
  644: %% (Pid2) under the name 'test'. Let another new process (Pid3)
  645: %% reregister itself under the same name. Test global:send/2. Test
  646: %% unregister. Kill Pid3. Start a process (Pid6) on cp3,
  647: %% register it as 'test', stop cp1 - cp3 and check that 'test' disappeared.
  648: %% Kill Pid2 and check that 'test' isn't registered.
  649: 
  650: names(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  651:     ?TC_TRY(names, fun() -> do_names(Config) end).
  652: 
  653: do_names(Config) ->
  654:     ?P("names -> begin when"
  655:        "~n   Nodes: ~p"
  656:        "~n   Names: ~p",
  657:        [nodes(),
  658:         case net_adm:names() of
  659:             {ok, N} ->
  660:                 N;
  661:             _ ->
  662:                 "-"
  663:         end]),
  664:     Timeout = 30,
  665:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
  666:     ?P("names -> init high level trace"),
  667:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
  668:     ?P("names -> init condition"),
  669:     init_condition(Config),
  670:     ?P("names -> get registered names"),
  671:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
  672: 
  673:     ?P("names -> start node cp1"),
  674:     {ok, Cp1} = start_node(cp1, Config),
  675:     ?P("names -> start node cp2"),
  676:     {ok, Cp2} = start_node(cp2, Config),
  677:     ?P("names -> start node cp3"),
  678:     {ok, Cp3} = start_node(cp3, Config),
  679: 
  680:     ?P("names -> wait for ready net"),
  681:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
  682: 
  683:     %% start a proc and register it
  684:     ?P("names -> start and register process 'test'"),
  685:     {Pid, yes} = start_proc(test),
  686: 
  687:     %% test that it is registered at all nodes
  688:     ?P("names -> verify process has been registered on all nodes"),
  689:         ?UNTIL(begin
  690:             (Pid =:= global:whereis_name(test)) and
  691:             (Pid =:= rpc:call(Cp1, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  692:             (Pid =:= rpc:call(Cp2, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  693:             (Pid =:= rpc:call(Cp3, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  694:             ([test] =:= global:registered_names() -- OrigNames)
  695:            end),
  696:     
  697:     %% try to register the same name
  698:     ?P("names -> try register (locally) another 'test' (and expect rejection)"),
  699:     no = global:register_name(test, self()),
  700:     ?P("names -> try register (on cp1) another 'test' (and expect rejection)"),
  701:     no = rpc:call(Cp1, global, register_name, [test, self()]),
  702:     
  703:     %% let process exit, check that it is unregistered automatically
  704:     ?P("names -> terminate the 'test' process"),
  705:     exit_p(Pid),
  706: 
  707:     ?P("names -> verify 'test' process has been automatically unregistered"),
  708:         ?UNTIL((undefined =:= global:whereis_name(test)) and
  709:            (undefined =:= rpc:call(Cp1, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  710:            (undefined =:= rpc:call(Cp2, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  711:            (undefined =:= rpc:call(Cp3, global, whereis_name, [test]))),
  712:     
  713:     %% test re_register
  714:     ?P("names -> start and register another process 'test'"),
  715:     {Pid2, yes} = start_proc(test),
  716:     ?P("names -> verify process 'test' has been registered"),
  717:     ?UNTIL(Pid2 =:= rpc:call(Cp3, global, whereis_name, [test])),
  718:     Pid3 = rpc:call(Cp3, ?MODULE, start_proc2, [test]),
  719:     ?UNTIL(Pid3 =:= rpc:call(Cp3, global, whereis_name, [test])),
  720:     Pid3 = global:whereis_name(test),
  721: 
  722:     %% test sending
  723:     ?P("names -> test sending (from local)"),
  724:     global:send(test, {ping, self()}),
  725:     receive
  726: 	{pong, Cp3} -> ok
  727:     after
  728: 	2000 -> ct:fail(timeout1)
  729:     end,
  730: 
  731:     ?P("names -> test sending (from cp1)"),
  732:     rpc:call(Cp1, global, send, [test, {ping, self()}]),
  733:     receive
  734: 	{pong, Cp3} -> ok
  735:     after
  736: 	2000 -> ct:fail(timeout2)
  737:     end,
  738: 
  739:     ?P("names -> unregister 'test' process"),
  740:     _ = global:unregister_name(test),
  741:         ?UNTIL((undefined =:= global:whereis_name(test)) and
  742:            (undefined =:= rpc:call(Cp1, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  743:            (undefined =:= rpc:call(Cp2, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  744:            (undefined =:= rpc:call(Cp3, global, whereis_name, [test]))),
  745: 
  746:     ?P("names -> terminate process 'test'"),
  747:     exit_p(Pid3),
  748: 
  749:     ?P("names -> verify not registered"),
  750:     ?UNTIL(undefined =:= global:whereis_name(test)),
  751: 
  752:     %% register a proc
  753:     ?P("names -> register a process"),
  754:     {_Pid6, yes} = rpc:call(Cp3, ?MODULE, start_proc, [test]),
  755: 
  756:     ?P("names -> write high level trace"),
  757:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
  758: 
  759:     %% stop the nodes, and make sure names are released.
  760:     ?P("names -> stop node cp1"),
  761:     stop_node(Cp1),
  762:     ?P("names -> stop node cp2"),
  763:     stop_node(Cp2),
  764:     ?P("names -> stop node cp3"),
  765:     stop_node(Cp3),
  766: 
  767:     ?P("names -> verify not registered"),
  768:     ?UNTIL(undefined =:= global:whereis_name(test)),
  769:     exit_p(Pid2),
  770: 
  771:     ?P("names -> verify not registered"),
  772:     ?UNTIL(undefined =:= global:whereis_name(test)),
  773:     init_condition(Config),
  774: 
  775:     ?P("names -> done"),
  776:     ok.
  777: 
  778: %% Tests that names on a hidden node doesn't interfere with names on
  779: %% visible nodes.
  780: names_hidden(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  781:     Timeout = 30,
  782:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
  783:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
  784:     init_condition(Config),
  785:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
  786:     OrigNodes = nodes(),
  787: 
  788:     {ok, Cp1} = start_node(cp1, Config),
  789:     {ok, Cp2} = start_node(cp2, Config),
  790:     {ok, Cp3} = start_hidden_node(cp3, Config),
  791:     pong = rpc:call(Cp1, net_adm, ping, [Cp3]),
  792:     pong = rpc:call(Cp3, net_adm, ping, [Cp2]),
  793:     pong = rpc:call(Cp3, net_adm, ping, [node()]),
  794: 
  795:     [] = [Cp1, Cp2 | OrigNodes] -- nodes(),
  796: 
  797:     %% start a proc on hidden node and register it
  798:     {HPid, yes} = rpc:call(Cp3, ?MODULE, start_proc, [test]),
  799:     Cp3 = node(HPid),
  800: 
  801:     %% Check that it didn't get registered on visible nodes
  802:         ?UNTIL((undefined =:= global:whereis_name(test)) and
  803:            (undefined =:= rpc:call(Cp1, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  804:            (undefined =:= rpc:call(Cp2, global, whereis_name, [test]))),
  805: 
  806:     %% start a proc on visible node and register it
  807:     {Pid, yes} = start_proc(test),
  808:     true = (Pid =/= HPid),
  809: 
  810:     %% test that it is registered at all nodes
  811:         ?UNTIL((Pid =:= global:whereis_name(test)) and
  812:            (Pid =:= rpc:call(Cp1, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  813:            (Pid =:= rpc:call(Cp2, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  814:            (HPid =:= rpc:call(Cp3, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  815:            ([test] =:= global:registered_names() -- OrigNames)),
  816:     
  817:     %% try to register the same name
  818:     no = global:register_name(test, self()),
  819:     no = rpc:call(Cp1, global, register_name, [test, self()]),
  820:     
  821:     %% let process exit, check that it is unregistered automatically
  822:     exit_p(Pid),
  823: 
  824:         ?UNTIL((undefined =:= global:whereis_name(test)) and
  825:            (undefined =:= rpc:call(Cp1, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  826:            (undefined =:= rpc:call(Cp2, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  827:            (HPid      =:= rpc:call(Cp3, global, whereis_name, [test]))),
  828:     
  829:     %% test re_register
  830:     {Pid2, yes} = start_proc(test),
  831:     ?UNTIL(Pid2 =:= rpc:call(Cp2, global, whereis_name, [test])),
  832:     Pid3 = rpc:call(Cp2, ?MODULE, start_proc2, [test]),
  833:     ?UNTIL(Pid3 =:= rpc:call(Cp2, global, whereis_name, [test])),
  834:     Pid3 = global:whereis_name(test),
  835: 
  836:     %% test sending
  837:     Pid3 = global:send(test, {ping, self()}),
  838:     receive
  839: 	{pong, Cp2} -> ok
  840:     after
  841: 	2000 -> ct:fail(timeout1)
  842:     end,
  843: 
  844:     rpc:call(Cp1, global, send, [test, {ping, self()}]),
  845:     receive
  846: 	{pong, Cp2} -> ok
  847:     after
  848: 	2000 -> ct:fail(timeout2)
  849:     end,
  850: 
  851:     _ = rpc:call(Cp3, global, unregister_name, [test]),
  852:         ?UNTIL((Pid3      =:= global:whereis_name(test)) and
  853:            (Pid3      =:= rpc:call(Cp1, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  854:            (Pid3      =:= rpc:call(Cp2, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  855:            (undefined =:= rpc:call(Cp3, global, whereis_name, [test]))),
  856: 
  857:     _ = global:unregister_name(test),
  858:         ?UNTIL((undefined =:= global:whereis_name(test)) and
  859:            (undefined =:= rpc:call(Cp1, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  860:            (undefined =:= rpc:call(Cp2, global, whereis_name, [test])) and
  861:            (undefined =:= rpc:call(Cp3, global, whereis_name, [test]))),
  862: 
  863:     exit_p(Pid3),
  864:     exit_p(HPid),
  865: 
  866:     ?UNTIL(undefined =:= global:whereis_name(test)),
  867: 
  868:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
  869: 
  870:     %% stop the nodes, and make sure names are released.
  871:     stop_node(Cp1),
  872:     stop_node(Cp2),
  873:     stop_node(Cp3),
  874: 
  875:     init_condition(Config),
  876:     ok.
  877: 
  878: locks(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  879:     Timeout = 30,
  880:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
  881:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
  882:     init_condition(Config),
  883:     {ok, Cp1} = start_node(cp1, Config),
  884:     {ok, Cp2} = start_node(cp2, Config),
  885:     {ok, Cp3} = start_node(cp3, Config),
  886: 
  887:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
  888: 
  889:     %% start two procs
  890:     Pid = start_proc(),
  891:     Pid2 = rpc:call(Cp1, ?MODULE, start_proc, []),
  892: 
  893:     %% set a lock, and make sure no one else can set the same lock
  894:     true = global:set_lock({test_lock, self()}, ?NODES, 1),
  895:     false = req(Pid, {set_lock, test_lock, self()}),
  896:     false = req(Pid2, {set_lock, test_lock, self()}),
  897: 
  898:     %% delete, and let another proc set the lock
  899:     global:del_lock({test_lock, self()}),
  900:     true = req(Pid, {set_lock, test_lock, self()}),
  901:     false = req(Pid2, {set_lock, test_lock, self()}),
  902:     false = global:set_lock({test_lock, self()}, ?NODES,1),
  903: 
  904:     %% kill lock-holding proc, make sure the lock is released
  905:     exit_p(Pid),
  906:     ?UNTIL(true =:= global:set_lock({test_lock, self()}, ?NODES,1)),
  907:     Pid2 ! {set_lock_loop, test_lock, self()},
  908: 
  909:     %% make sure we don't have the msg
  910:     receive
  911: 	{got_lock, Pid2} -> ct:fail(got_lock)
  912:     after
  913: 	1000 -> ok
  914:     end,
  915:     global:del_lock({test_lock, self()}),
  916: 
  917:     %% make sure pid2 got the lock
  918:     receive
  919: 	{got_lock, Pid2} -> ok
  920:     after
  921: 	%% 12000 >> 5000, which is the max time before a new retry for
  922:         %% set_lock
  923: 	12000 -> ct:fail(got_lock2)
  924:     end,
  925: 
  926:     %% let proc set the same lock
  927:     true = req(Pid2, {set_lock, test_lock, self()}),
  928: 
  929:     %% let proc set new lock
  930:     true = req(Pid2, {set_lock, test_lock2, self()}),
  931:     false = global:set_lock({test_lock, self()},?NODES,1),
  932:     false = global:set_lock({test_lock2, self()}, ?NODES,1),
  933:     exit_p(Pid2),
  934:     ?UNTIL(true =:= global:set_lock({test_lock, self()}, ?NODES, 1)),
  935:     ?UNTIL(true =:= global:set_lock({test_lock2, self()}, ?NODES, 1)),
  936:     global:del_lock({test_lock, self()}),
  937:     global:del_lock({test_lock2, self()}),
  938: 
  939:     %% let proc set two locks
  940:     Pid3 = rpc:call(Cp1, ?MODULE, start_proc, []),
  941:     true = req(Pid3, {set_lock, test_lock, self()}),
  942:     true = req(Pid3, {set_lock, test_lock2, self()}),
  943: 
  944:     %% del one lock
  945:     Pid3 ! {del_lock, test_lock2},
  946:     ct:sleep(100),
  947: 
  948:     %% check that one lock is still set, but not the other
  949:     false = global:set_lock({test_lock, self()}, ?NODES, 1),
  950:     true = global:set_lock({test_lock2, self()}, ?NODES, 1),
  951:     global:del_lock({test_lock2, self()}),
  952: 
  953:     %% kill lock-holder
  954:     exit_p(Pid3),
  955: 
  956:     ?UNTIL(true =:= global:set_lock({test_lock, self()}, ?NODES, 1)),
  957:     global:del_lock({test_lock, self()}),
  958:     ?UNTIL(true =:= global:set_lock({test_lock2, self()}, ?NODES, 1)),
  959:     global:del_lock({test_lock2, self()}),
  960: 
  961:     %% start one proc on each node
  962:     Pid4 = start_proc(),
  963:     Pid5 = rpc:call(Cp1, ?MODULE, start_proc, []),
  964:     Pid6 = rpc:call(Cp2, ?MODULE, start_proc, []),
  965:     Pid7 = rpc:call(Cp3, ?MODULE, start_proc, []),
  966: 
  967:     %% set lock on two nodes
  968:     true = req(Pid4, {set_lock, test_lock, self(), [node(), Cp1]}),
  969:     false = req(Pid5, {set_lock, test_lock, self(), [node(), Cp1]}),
  970: 
  971:     %% set same lock on other two nodes
  972:     true = req(Pid6, {set_lock, test_lock, self(), [Cp2, Cp3]}),
  973:     false = req(Pid7, {set_lock, test_lock, self(), [Cp2, Cp3]}),
  974: 
  975:     %% release lock
  976:     Pid6 ! {del_lock, test_lock, [Cp2, Cp3]},
  977: 
  978:     %% try to set lock on a node that already has the lock
  979:     false = req(Pid6, {set_lock, test_lock, self(), [Cp1, Cp2, Cp3]}),
  980: 
  981:     %% set lock on a node
  982:     exit_p(Pid4),
  983:     ?UNTIL(true =:= req(Pid5, {set_lock, test_lock, self(), [node(), Cp1]})),
  984:     Pid8 = start_proc(),
  985:     false = req(Pid8, {set_lock, test_lock, self()}),
  986:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
  987: 
  988:     %% stop the nodes, and make sure locks are released.
  989:     stop_node(Cp1),
  990:     stop_node(Cp2),
  991:     stop_node(Cp3),
  992:     ct:sleep(100),
  993:     true = req(Pid8, {set_lock, test_lock, self()}),
  994:     exit_p(Pid8),
  995:     ct:sleep(10),
  996: 
  997:     init_condition(Config),
  998:     ok.
  999: 
 1000: 
 1001: %% Tests that locks on a hidden node doesn't interere with locks on
 1002: %% visible nodes.
 1003: locks_hidden(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1004:     Timeout = 30,
 1005:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 1006:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 1007:     init_condition(Config),
 1008:     OrigNodes = nodes(),
 1009:     {ok, Cp1} = start_node(cp1, Config),
 1010:     {ok, Cp2} = start_node(cp2, Config),
 1011:     {ok, Cp3} = start_hidden_node(cp3, Config),
 1012:     pong = rpc:call(Cp1, net_adm, ping, [Cp3]),
 1013:     pong = rpc:call(Cp3, net_adm, ping, [Cp2]),
 1014:     pong = rpc:call(Cp3, net_adm, ping, [node()]),
 1015: 
 1016:     [] = [Cp1, Cp2 | OrigNodes] -- nodes(),
 1017: 
 1018:     %% start two procs
 1019:     Pid = start_proc(),
 1020:     Pid2 = rpc:call(Cp1, ?MODULE, start_proc, []),
 1021:     HPid = rpc:call(Cp3, ?MODULE, start_proc, []),
 1022: 
 1023:     %% Make sure hidden node doesn't interfere with visible nodes lock
 1024:     true = req(HPid, {set_lock, test_lock, self()}),
 1025:     true = global:set_lock({test_lock, self()}, ?NODES, 1),
 1026:     false = req(Pid, {set_lock, test_lock, self()}),
 1027:     true = req(HPid, {del_lock_sync, test_lock, self()}),
 1028:     false = req(Pid2, {set_lock, test_lock, self()}),
 1029: 
 1030:     %% delete, and let another proc set the lock
 1031:     global:del_lock({test_lock, self()}),
 1032:     true = req(Pid, {set_lock, test_lock, self()}),
 1033:     false = req(Pid2, {set_lock, test_lock, self()}),
 1034:     false = global:set_lock({test_lock, self()}, ?NODES,1),
 1035: 
 1036:     %% kill lock-holding proc, make sure the lock is released
 1037:     exit_p(Pid),
 1038:     ?UNTIL(true =:= global:set_lock({test_lock, self()}, ?NODES, 1)),
 1039:     ?UNTIL(true =:= req(HPid, {set_lock, test_lock, self()})),
 1040:     Pid2 ! {set_lock_loop, test_lock, self()},
 1041: 
 1042:     %% make sure we don't have the msg
 1043:     receive
 1044: 	{got_lock, Pid2} -> ct:fail(got_lock)
 1045:     after
 1046: 	1000 -> ok
 1047:     end,
 1048:     global:del_lock({test_lock, self()}),
 1049: 
 1050:     %% make sure pid2 got the lock
 1051:     receive
 1052: 	{got_lock, Pid2} -> ok
 1053:     after
 1054: 	%% 12000 >> 5000, which is the max time before a new retry for
 1055:         %% set_lock
 1056: 	12000 -> ct:fail(got_lock2)
 1057:     end,
 1058:     true = req(HPid, {del_lock_sync, test_lock, self()}),
 1059: 
 1060:     %% let proc set the same lock
 1061:     true = req(Pid2, {set_lock, test_lock, self()}),
 1062: 
 1063:     %% let proc set new lock
 1064:     true = req(Pid2, {set_lock, test_lock2, self()}),
 1065:     true = req(HPid, {set_lock, test_lock, self()}),
 1066:     true = req(HPid, {set_lock, test_lock2, self()}),
 1067:     exit_p(HPid),
 1068:     false = global:set_lock({test_lock, self()},?NODES,1),
 1069:     false = global:set_lock({test_lock2, self()}, ?NODES,1),
 1070: 
 1071:     exit_p(Pid2),
 1072:     ?UNTIL(true =:= global:set_lock({test_lock, self()}, ?NODES, 1)),
 1073:     ?UNTIL(true =:= global:set_lock({test_lock2, self()}, ?NODES, 1)),
 1074:     global:del_lock({test_lock, self()}),
 1075:     global:del_lock({test_lock2, self()}),
 1076: 
 1077:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 1078: 
 1079:     %% stop the nodes, and make sure locks are released.
 1080:     stop_node(Cp1),
 1081:     stop_node(Cp2),
 1082:     stop_node(Cp3),
 1083: 
 1084:     init_condition(Config),
 1085:     ok.
 1086: 
 1087: 
 1088: bad_input(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1089:     Timeout = 15,
 1090:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 1091:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 1092:     init_condition(Config),
 1093:     Pid = whereis(global_name_server),
 1094:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch global:set_lock(bad_id)),
 1095:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch global:set_lock({id, self()}, bad_nodes)),
 1096:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch global:del_lock(bad_id)),
 1097:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch global:del_lock({id, self()}, bad_nodes)),
 1098:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch global:register_name(name, bad_pid)),
 1099:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch global:reregister_name(name, bad_pid)),
 1100:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch global:trans(bad_id, {m,f})),
 1101:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch global:trans({id, self()}, {m,f}, [node()], -1)),
 1102:     Pid = whereis(global_name_server),
 1103:     init_condition(Config),
 1104:     ok.
 1105: 
 1106: names_and_locks(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1107:     Timeout = 30,
 1108:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 1109:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 1110:     init_condition(Config),
 1111:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 1112: 
 1113:     {ok, Cp1} = start_node(cp1, Config),
 1114:     {ok, Cp2} = start_node(cp2, Config),
 1115:     {ok, Cp3} = start_node(cp3, Config),
 1116: 
 1117:     %% start one proc on each node
 1118:     PidTS = start_proc(),
 1119:     Pid1 = rpc:call(Cp1, ?MODULE, start_proc, []),
 1120:     Pid2 = rpc:call(Cp2, ?MODULE, start_proc, []),
 1121:     Pid3 = rpc:call(Cp3, ?MODULE, start_proc, []),
 1122: 
 1123:     %% register some of them
 1124:     yes = global:register_name(test1, Pid1),
 1125:     yes = global:register_name(test2, Pid2),
 1126:     yes = global:register_name(test3, Pid3),
 1127:     no = global:register_name(test3, PidTS),
 1128:     yes = global:register_name(test4, PidTS),
 1129: 
 1130:     %% set lock on two nodes
 1131:     true = req(PidTS, {set_lock, test_lock, self(), [node(), Cp1]}),
 1132:     false = req(Pid1, {set_lock, test_lock, self(), [node(), Cp1]}),
 1133: 
 1134:     %% set same lock on other two nodes
 1135:     true = req(Pid2, {set_lock, test_lock, self(), [Cp2, Cp3]}),
 1136:     false = req(Pid3, {set_lock, test_lock, self(), [Cp2, Cp3]}),
 1137: 
 1138:     %% release lock
 1139:     Pid2 ! {del_lock, test_lock, [Cp2, Cp3]},
 1140:     ct:sleep(100),
 1141: 
 1142:     %% try to set lock on a node that already has the lock
 1143:     false = req(Pid2, {set_lock, test_lock, self(), [Cp1, Cp2, Cp3]}),
 1144: 
 1145:     %% set two locks
 1146:     true = req(Pid2, {set_lock, test_lock, self(), [Cp2, Cp3]}),
 1147:     true = req(Pid2, {set_lock, test_lock2, self(), [Cp2, Cp3]}),
 1148: 
 1149:     %% kill some processes, make sure all locks/names are released
 1150:     exit_p(PidTS),
 1151:     ?UNTIL(undefined =:= global:whereis_name(test4)),
 1152:     true = global:set_lock({test_lock, self()}, [node(), Cp1], 1),
 1153:     global:del_lock({test_lock, self()}, [node(), Cp1]),
 1154:     
 1155:     exit_p(Pid2),
 1156:         ?UNTIL((undefined =:= global:whereis_name(test2)) and
 1157:            (true =:= global:set_lock({test_lock, self()}, [Cp2, Cp3], 1)) and
 1158:            (true =:= global:set_lock({test_lock2, self()}, [Cp2, Cp3], 1))),
 1159: 
 1160:     global:del_lock({test_lock, self()}, [Cp2, Cp3]),
 1161:     global:del_lock({test_lock2, self()}, [Cp2, Cp3]),
 1162: 
 1163:     exit_p(Pid1),
 1164:     exit_p(Pid3),
 1165: 
 1166:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 1167: 
 1168:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 1169:     stop_node(Cp1),
 1170:     stop_node(Cp2),
 1171:     stop_node(Cp3),
 1172: 
 1173:     init_condition(Config),
 1174:     ok.
 1175: 
 1176: %% OTP-6341. Remove locks using monitors.
 1177: lock_die(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1178:     Timeout = 30,
 1179:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 1180:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 1181:     init_condition(Config),
 1182:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 1183: 
 1184:     {ok, Cp1} = start_node(cp1, Config),
 1185:     {ok, Cp2} = start_node(cp2, Config),
 1186: 
 1187:     %% First test.
 1188:     LockId = {id, self()},
 1189:     Pid2 = start_proc(),
 1190:     true = req(Pid2, {set_lock2, LockId, self()}),
 1191: 
 1192:     true = global:set_lock(LockId, [Cp1]),
 1193:     %% Id is locked on Cp1 and Cp2 (by Pid2) but not by self(): 
 1194:     %% (there is no mon. ref)
 1195:     _ = global:del_lock(LockId, [node(), Cp1, Cp2]),
 1196: 
 1197:     exit_p(Pid2),
 1198: 
 1199:     %% Second test.
 1200:     Pid3 = start_proc(),
 1201:     true = req(Pid3, {set_lock, id, self(), [Cp1]}),
 1202:     %% The lock is removed from Cp1 thanks to monitors.
 1203:     exit_p(Pid3),
 1204: 
 1205:     true = global:set_lock(LockId, [node(), Cp1]),
 1206:     _ = global:del_lock(LockId, [node(), Cp1]),
 1207: 
 1208:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 1209:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 1210:     stop_node(Cp1),
 1211:     stop_node(Cp2),
 1212:     init_condition(Config),
 1213:     ok.
 1214: 
 1215: %% OTP-6341. Remove names using monitors.
 1216: name_die(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1217:     Timeout = 30,
 1218:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 1219:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 1220:     init_condition(Config),
 1221:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 1222:     [Cp1] = Cps = start_nodes([z], peer,  Config), % z > test_server
 1223:     Nodes = lists:sort([node() | Cps]),
 1224:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 1225: 
 1226:     Name = name_die,
 1227:     Pid = rpc:call(Cp1, ?MODULE, start_proc, []),
 1228: 
 1229:     %% Test 1. No resolver is called if the same pid is registered on
 1230:     %% both partitions.
 1231:     T1 = node(),
 1232:     Part1 = [T1],
 1233:     Part2 = [Cp1],
 1234: 
 1235:     PartCtrlr = setup_partitions(Config, [Part1, Part2]),
 1236: 
 1237:     ?UNTIL(undefined =:= global:whereis_name(Name)),
 1238:     yes = global:register_name(Name, Pid),
 1239: 
 1240:     pong = net_adm:ping(Cp1),
 1241:     wait_for_ready_net(Nodes, Config),
 1242:     assert_pid(global:whereis_name(Name)),
 1243:     exit_p(Pid),
 1244:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 1245: 
 1246:     %% Test 2. Register a name running outside the current partition.
 1247:     %% Killing the pid will not remove the name from the current
 1248:     %% partition, unless monitors are used.
 1249:     Pid2 = rpc:call(Cp1, ?MODULE, start_proc, []),
 1250:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1251:     KillFile = filename:join([Dir, "kill.txt"]),
 1252:     file:delete(KillFile),
 1253:     erlang:spawn(Cp1, fun() -> kill_pid(Pid2, KillFile, Config) end),
 1254: 
 1255:     setup_partitions(PartCtrlr, [Part1, Part2]),
 1256: 
 1257:     ?UNTIL(undefined =:= global:whereis_name(Name)),
 1258:     yes = global:register_name(Name, Pid2),
 1259:     touch(KillFile, "kill"),
 1260:     file_contents(KillFile, "done", Config),
 1261:     file:delete(KillFile),
 1262: 
 1263:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 1264:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 1265:     stop_nodes(Cps),
 1266:     stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr),
 1267:     init_condition(Config),
 1268:     ok.
 1269: 
 1270: kill_pid(Pid, File, Config) ->
 1271:     file_contents(File, "kill", Config),
 1272:     exit_p(Pid),
 1273:     touch(File, "done").
 1274: 
 1275: %% Tests that two partitioned networks exchange correct info.
 1276: basic_partition(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1277:     Timeout = 30,
 1278:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 1279:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 1280:     init_condition(Config),
 1281:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 1282: 
 1283:     [Cp1, Cp2, Cp3] = start_nodes([cp1, cp2, cp3], peer, Config),
 1284:     [Cp1, Cp2, Cp3] = lists:sort(nodes()),
 1285: 
 1286:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 1287: 
 1288:     %% make cp2 and cp3 connected, partitioned from us and cp1
 1289:     PCtrlr = setup_partitions(Config, [[node(), Cp1], [Cp2, Cp3]]),
 1290: 
 1291:     %% start different processes in both partitions
 1292:     {Pid, yes} = start_proc(test),
 1293: 
 1294:     %% Reach into the other partition via PCtrlr...
 1295:     ok = erpc:call(
 1296:            PCtrlr,
 1297:            fun () ->
 1298:                    {_, yes} = erpc:call(Cp2, ?MODULE,
 1299:                                         start_proc, [test2]),
 1300:                    {_, yes} = erpc:call(Cp1, ?MODULE,
 1301:                                         start_proc, [test4]),
 1302:                    ok
 1303:            end),
 1304: 
 1305:     %% connect to other partition
 1306:     pong = net_adm:ping(Cp2),
 1307:     pong = net_adm:ping(Cp3),
 1308:     wait_until(fun () -> [Cp1, Cp2, Cp3] == lists:sort(nodes()) end),
 1309: 
 1310:     %% check names
 1311:     ?UNTIL(Pid =:= rpc:call(Cp2, global, whereis_name, [test])),
 1312:     ?UNTIL(undefined =/= global:whereis_name(test2)),
 1313:     Pid2 = global:whereis_name(test2),
 1314:     Pid2 = rpc:call(Cp2, global, whereis_name, [test2]),
 1315:     assert_pid(Pid2),
 1316:     Pid3 = global:whereis_name(test4),
 1317:     ?UNTIL(Pid3 =:= rpc:call(Cp1, global, whereis_name, [test4])),
 1318:     assert_pid(Pid3),
 1319: 
 1320:     %% kill all procs
 1321:     Pid3 = global:send(test4, die),
 1322:     %% sleep to let the proc die
 1323:     wait_for_exit(Pid3),
 1324:     ?UNTIL(undefined =:= global:whereis_name(test4)),
 1325: 
 1326:     exit_p(Pid),
 1327:     exit_p(Pid2),
 1328: 
 1329:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 1330: 
 1331:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 1332:     stop_node(Cp1),
 1333:     stop_node(Cp2),
 1334:     stop_node(Cp3),
 1335:     stop_node(PCtrlr),
 1336:     init_condition(Config),
 1337:     ok.
 1338: 
 1339: %% Creates two partitions with two nodes in each partition.
 1340: %% Tests that names are exchanged correctly, and that EXITs
 1341: %% during connect phase are handled correctly.
 1342: basic_name_partition(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1343:     Timeout = 60,
 1344:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 1345:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 1346:     init_condition(Config),
 1347:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 1348: 
 1349:     [Cp1, Cp2, Cp3] = start_nodes([cp1, cp2, cp3], peer, Config),
 1350:     [Cp1, Cp2, Cp3] = lists:sort(nodes()),
 1351:     Nodes = ?NODES,
 1352: 
 1353:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 1354: 
 1355:     %% There used to be more than one name registered for some
 1356:     %% processes. That was a mistake; there is no support for more than
 1357:     %% one name per process, and the manual is quite clear about that
 1358:     %% ("equivalent to the register/2 and whereis/1 BIFs"). The
 1359:     %% resolver procedure did not take care of such "duplicated" names,
 1360:     %% which caused this testcase to fail every now and then.
 1361: 
 1362:     %% make cp2 and cp3 connected, partitioned from us and cp1
 1363:     %% us:  register name03
 1364:     %% cp1: register name12
 1365:     %% cp2: register name12
 1366:     %% cp3: register name03
 1367: 
 1368:     PCtrlr = setup_partitions(Config, [[node(), Cp1], [Cp2, Cp3]]),
 1369: 
 1370:     %% start different processes in both partitions
 1371:     {_, yes} = start_proc_basic(name03),
 1372:     {_, yes} = erpc:call(Cp1, ?MODULE, start_proc_basic, [name12]),
 1373: 
 1374:     %% Reach into the other partition via PCtrlr...
 1375:     ok = erpc:call(
 1376:            PCtrlr,
 1377:            fun () ->
 1378:                    {_, yes} = erpc:call(Cp2, ?MODULE,
 1379:                                         start_proc_basic, [name12]),
 1380:                    {_, yes} = erpc:call(Cp3, ?MODULE,
 1381:                                         start_proc_basic, [name03]),
 1382:                    ok
 1383:            end),
 1384: 
 1385:     ct:sleep(1000),
 1386: 
 1387:     %% connect to other partition
 1388:     pong = net_adm:ping(Cp3),
 1389: 
 1390:     ?UNTIL([Cp1, Cp2, Cp3] =:= lists:sort(nodes())),
 1391:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 1392: 
 1393:     %% check names
 1394:     Pid03 = global:whereis_name(name03),
 1395:     assert_pid(Pid03),
 1396:     true = lists:member(node(Pid03), [node(), Cp3]),
 1397:     check_everywhere(Nodes, name03, Config),
 1398: 
 1399:     Pid12 = global:whereis_name(name12),
 1400:     assert_pid(Pid12),
 1401:     true = lists:member(node(Pid12), [Cp1, Cp2]),
 1402:     check_everywhere(Nodes, name12, Config),
 1403: 
 1404:     %% kill all procs
 1405:     Pid12 = global:send(name12, die),
 1406:     Pid03 = global:send(name03, die),
 1407: 
 1408:     %% sleep to let the procs die
 1409:     wait_for_exit(Pid12),
 1410:     wait_for_exit(Pid03),
 1411:     ?UNTIL(begin
 1412: 	       Names = [name03, name12],
 1413: 	       lists:duplicate(length(Names), undefined)
 1414: 		   =:= [global:whereis_name(Name) || Name <- Names]
 1415: 	   end),
 1416: 
 1417:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 1418: 
 1419:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 1420:     stop_node(Cp1),
 1421:     stop_node(Cp2),
 1422:     stop_node(Cp3),
 1423:     stop_node(PCtrlr),
 1424:     init_condition(Config),
 1425:     ok.
 1426: 
 1427: %% Peer nodes cp0 - cp6 are started. Break apart the connections from
 1428: %% cp3-cp6 to cp0-cp2 and test_server so we get two partitions.
 1429: %% In the cp3-cp6 partition, start one process on each node and register
 1430: %% using both erlang:register, and global:register (test1 on cp3, test2 on
 1431: %% cp4, test3 on cp5, test4 on cp6), using different resolution functions:
 1432: %% default for test1, notify_all_name for test2, random_notify_name for test3
 1433: %% and one for test4 that sends a message to test_server and keeps the
 1434: %% process which is greater in the standard ordering. In the other partition,
 1435: %% do the same (test1 on test_server, test2 on cp0, test3 on cp1, test4 on cp2).
 1436: %% Sleep a little, then from test_server, connect to cp3-cp6 in order.
 1437: %% Check that the values for the registered names are the expected ones, and
 1438: %% that the messages from test4 arrive.
 1439: 
 1440: %% Test that names are resolved correctly when two
 1441: %% partitioned networks connect.
 1442: advanced_partition(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1443:     Timeout = 60,
 1444:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 1445:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 1446:     init_condition(Config),
 1447:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 1448: 
 1449:     Parent = self(),
 1450: 
 1451:     [Cp0, Cp1, Cp2, Cp3, Cp4, Cp5, Cp6]
 1452: 	= start_nodes([cp0, cp1, cp2, cp3, cp4, cp5, cp6], peer, Config),
 1453:     Nodes = lists:sort([node(), Cp0, Cp1, Cp2, Cp3, Cp4, Cp5, Cp6]),
 1454:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 1455: 
 1456:     %% make cp3-cp6 connected, partitioned from us and cp0-cp2
 1457:     PCntrlr = setup_partitions(Config, [[node(), Cp0, Cp1, Cp2], [Cp3, Cp4, Cp5, Cp6]]),
 1458: 
 1459:     %% start processes in other partition (via partition controller)...
 1460:     _ = erpc:call(PCntrlr,
 1461:                   fun () ->
 1462:                           erpc:call(Cp3,
 1463:                                     fun () ->
 1464:                                             start_procs(Parent, Cp4, Cp5, Cp6, Config)
 1465:                                     end)
 1466:                   end),
 1467: 
 1468:     %% start different processes in this partition
 1469:     start_procs(self(), Cp0, Cp1, Cp2, Config),
 1470: 
 1471:     %% connect to other partition
 1472:     pong = net_adm:ping(Cp3),
 1473: 
 1474:     wait_until(fun () ->
 1475:                        CurrNodes = lists:sort(?NODES),
 1476:                        io:format("CurrNodes: ~p~n", [CurrNodes]),
 1477:                        Nodes == CurrNodes end),
 1478: 
 1479:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 1480: 
 1481:     ?UNTIL(lists:member(undefined,
 1482: 			[rpc:call(Cp3, erlang, whereis, [test1]),
 1483: 			 rpc:call(node(), erlang, whereis, [test1])])),
 1484: 
 1485:     Nt1 = rpc:call(Cp3, erlang, whereis, [test1]),
 1486:     Nt2 = rpc:call(Cp4, erlang, whereis, [test2]),
 1487:     Nt3 = rpc:call(Cp5, erlang, whereis, [test3]),
 1488:     Nt4 = rpc:call(Cp6, erlang, whereis, [test4]),
 1489: 
 1490:     Mt1 = rpc:call(node(), erlang, whereis, [test1]),
 1491:     Mt2 = rpc:call(Cp0, erlang, whereis, [test2]),
 1492:     Mt3 = rpc:call(Cp1, erlang, whereis, [test3]),
 1493:     _Mt4 = rpc:call(Cp2, erlang, whereis, [test4]),
 1494: 
 1495:     %% check names
 1496:     Pid1 = global:whereis_name(test1),
 1497:     Pid1 = rpc:call(Cp3, global, whereis_name, [test1]),
 1498:     assert_pid(Pid1),
 1499:     true = lists:member(Pid1, [Nt1, Mt1]),
 1500:     true = lists:member(undefined, [Nt1, Mt1]),
 1501:     check_everywhere(Nodes, test1, Config),
 1502: 
 1503:     undefined = global:whereis_name(test2),
 1504:     undefined = rpc:call(Cp3, global, whereis_name, [test2]),
 1505:     yes = sreq(Nt2, {got_notify, self()}),
 1506:     yes = sreq(Mt2, {got_notify, self()}),
 1507:     check_everywhere(Nodes, test2, Config),
 1508: 
 1509:     Pid3 = global:whereis_name(test3),
 1510:     Pid3 = rpc:call(Cp3, global, whereis_name, [test3]),
 1511:     assert_pid(Pid3),
 1512:     true = lists:member(Pid3, [Nt3, Mt3]),
 1513:     no = sreq(Pid3, {got_notify, self()}),
 1514:     yes = sreq(other(Pid3, [Nt2, Nt3]), {got_notify, self()}),
 1515:     check_everywhere(Nodes, test3, Config),
 1516: 
 1517:     Pid4 = global:whereis_name(test4),
 1518:     Pid4 = rpc:call(Cp3, global, whereis_name, [test4]),
 1519:     assert_pid(Pid4),
 1520:     Pid4 = Nt4,
 1521:     check_everywhere(Nodes, test4, Config),
 1522: 
 1523:     1 = collect_resolves(),
 1524: 
 1525:     Pid1 = global:send(test1, die),
 1526:     exit_p(Pid3),
 1527:     exit_p(Pid4),
 1528:     wait_for_exit(Pid1),
 1529:     wait_for_exit(Pid3),
 1530:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 1531: 
 1532:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 1533:     stop_node(Cp0),
 1534:     stop_node(Cp1),
 1535:     stop_node(Cp2),
 1536:     stop_node(Cp3),
 1537:     stop_node(Cp4),
 1538:     stop_node(Cp5),
 1539:     stop_node(Cp6),
 1540:     stop_node(PCntrlr),
 1541:     init_condition(Config),
 1542:     ok.
 1543: 
 1544: %% Peer nodes cp0 - cp6 are started, and partitioned just like in
 1545: %% advanced_partition. Start cp8, only connected to test_server. Let cp6
 1546: %% break apart from the rest, and 12 s later, ping cp0 and cp3, and
 1547: %% register the name test5. After the same 12 s, let cp5 halt.
 1548: %% Wait for the death of cp5. Ping cp3 (at the same time as cp6 does).
 1549: %% Take down cp2. Start cp7, restart cp2. Ping cp4, cp6 and cp8.
 1550: %% Now, expect all nodes to be connected and have the same picture of all
 1551: %% registered names.
 1552: 
 1553: %% Stress global, make a partitioned net, make some nodes
 1554: %% go up/down a bit.
 1555: stress_partition(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1556:     Timeout = 90,
 1557:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 1558:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 1559:     init_condition(Config),
 1560:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 1561: 
 1562:     Parent = self(),
 1563: 
 1564:     [Cp0, Cp1, Cp2, Cp3, Cp4, Cp5, Cp6a, Cp6b]
 1565: 	= start_nodes([cp0, cp1, cp2, cp3, cp4, cp5, cp6a, cp6b], peer, Config),
 1566: 
 1567:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 1568: 
 1569:     %% make cp3-cp5 connected, partitioned from us and cp0-cp2
 1570:     %% cp6 is alone (single node).  cp6 pings cp0 and cp3 in 12 secs...
 1571:     PCntrlr = setup_partitions(Config, [[node(), Cp0, Cp1, Cp2], [Cp3, Cp4, Cp5, Cp6a], [Cp6b]]),
 1572: 
 1573:     %% start processes in other partition (via partition controller)...
 1574:     _ = erpc:call(PCntrlr,
 1575:                   fun () ->
 1576:                           erpc:call(Cp3,
 1577:                                     fun () ->
 1578:                                             start_procs(Parent, Cp4, Cp5, Cp6a, Config)
 1579:                                     end),
 1580:                           erpc:call(Cp6b,
 1581:                                     fun () ->
 1582:                                             Pid1 = start_proc3(test1),
 1583:                                             assert_pid(Pid1),
 1584:                                             Pid2 = start_proc3(test3),
 1585:                                             assert_pid(Pid2),
 1586:                                             yes = global:register_name(
 1587:                                                     test1, Pid1),
 1588:                                             yes = global:register_name(
 1589:                                                     test3, Pid2,
 1590:                                                     fun global:random_notify_name/3)
 1591:                                     end),
 1592:                           %% Make Cp5 crash
 1593:                           erpc:cast(Cp5, ?MODULE, crash, [12000]),
 1594:                           %% Make Cp6b alone
 1595:                           erpc:cast(Cp6b, ?MODULE, alone, [Cp0, Cp3])
 1596:                   end),
 1597: 
 1598:     erlang:display(starting_test),
 1599:     %% start different processes in this partition
 1600:     start_procs(self(), Cp0, Cp1, Cp2, Config),
 1601: 
 1602:     {ok, Cp8} = start_peer_node(cp8, Config),
 1603: 
 1604:     monitor_node(Cp5, true),
 1605:     receive
 1606: 	{nodedown, Cp5} -> ok
 1607:     after
 1608: 	20000 -> ct:fail({no_nodedown, Cp5})
 1609:     end,
 1610:     monitor_node(Cp5, false),    
 1611: 
 1612:     %% Ok, now cp6 pings us, and cp5 will go down.
 1613: 
 1614:     %% connect to other partition
 1615:     pong = net_adm:ping(Cp3),
 1616:     pong = net_adm:ping(Cp4),
 1617:     rpc_cast(Cp2, ?MODULE, crash, [0]),
 1618: 
 1619:     %% Start new nodes
 1620:     {ok, Cp7} = start_peer_node(cp7, Config),
 1621:     {ok, Cp2_2} = start_peer_node(cp2, Config),
 1622:     Nodes = lists:sort([node(), Cp0, Cp1, Cp2_2, Cp3, Cp4, Cp6a, Cp6b, Cp7, Cp8]),
 1623:     put(?nodes_tag, Nodes),
 1624: 
 1625:     %% We don't know how the crashes partitions the net, so
 1626:     %% we cast trough all nodes so we get them all connected
 1627:     %% again...
 1628:     cast_line(Nodes),
 1629: 
 1630:     wait_for_ready_net(Nodes, Config),
 1631: 
 1632:     %% Make sure that all nodes have the same picture of all names
 1633:     check_everywhere(Nodes, test1, Config),
 1634:     assert_pid(global:whereis_name(test1)),
 1635: 
 1636:     check_everywhere(Nodes, test2, Config),
 1637:     undefined = global:whereis_name(test2),
 1638: 
 1639:     check_everywhere(Nodes, test3, Config),
 1640:     assert_pid(global:whereis_name(test3)),
 1641: 
 1642:     check_everywhere(Nodes, test4, Config),
 1643:     assert_pid(global:whereis_name(test4)),
 1644: 
 1645:     check_everywhere(Nodes, test5, Config),
 1646:     ?UNTIL(undefined =:= global:whereis_name(test5)),
 1647: 
 1648:     assert_pid(global:send(test1, die)),
 1649:     assert_pid(global:send(test3, die)),
 1650:     assert_pid(global:send(test4, die)),
 1651: 
 1652:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 1653: 
 1654:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 1655:     stop_node(Cp0),
 1656:     stop_node(Cp1),
 1657:     stop_node(Cp2_2),
 1658:     stop_node(Cp3),
 1659:     stop_node(Cp4),
 1660:     stop_node(Cp5),
 1661:     stop_node(Cp6a),
 1662:     stop_node(Cp6b),
 1663:     stop_node(Cp7),
 1664:     stop_node(Cp8),
 1665:     stop_node(PCntrlr),
 1666:     init_condition(Config),
 1667:     ok.
 1668: 
 1669: 
 1670: %% Use this one to test a lot of connection tests
 1671: %%  erl -sname ts -ring_line 10000 -s test_server run_test global_SUITE
 1672: 
 1673: ring_line(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1674:     {ok, [[N]]} = init:get_argument(ring_line),
 1675:     loop_it(list_to_integer(N), Config).
 1676: 
 1677: loop_it(N, Config) -> loop_it(N,N, Config).
 1678: 
 1679: loop_it(0,_, _Config) -> ok;
 1680: loop_it(N,M, Config) ->
 1681:     ct:pal(?HI_VERBOSITY, "Round: ~w", [M-N]),
 1682:     ring(Config),
 1683:     line(Config),
 1684:     loop_it(N-1,M, Config).
 1685: 
 1686: 
 1687: %% Make 10 single nodes, all having the same name.
 1688: %% Make all ping its predecessor, pinging in a ring.
 1689: %% Make sure that there's just one winner.
 1690: ring(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1691:     Timeout = 60,
 1692:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 1693:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 1694:     init_condition(Config),
 1695:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 1696: 
 1697:     [Cp0, Cp1, Cp2, Cp3, Cp4, Cp5, Cp6, Cp7, Cp8]
 1698: 	= start_nodes([cp0, cp1, cp2, cp3, cp4, cp5, cp6, cp7, cp8], 
 1699:                       peer, Config),
 1700:     Nodes = lists:sort([node(), Cp0, Cp1, Cp2, Cp3, Cp4, Cp5, Cp6, Cp7, Cp8]),
 1701: 
 1702:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 1703: 
 1704:     PartCtrlr = setup_partitions(Config,
 1705:                                  [[node()], [Cp0], [Cp1], [Cp2], [Cp3],
 1706:                                   [Cp4], [Cp5], [Cp6], [Cp7], [Cp8]]),
 1707: 
 1708:     Time = msec() + 1000,
 1709: 
 1710:     ok = erpc:call(
 1711:            PartCtrlr,
 1712:            fun () ->
 1713:                    erpc:cast(Cp0, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp8]), % ping ourself!
 1714:                    erpc:cast(Cp1, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp0]),
 1715:                    erpc:cast(Cp2, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp1]),
 1716:                    erpc:cast(Cp3, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp2]),
 1717:                    erpc:cast(Cp4, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp3]),
 1718:                    erpc:cast(Cp5, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp4]),
 1719:                    erpc:cast(Cp6, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp5]),
 1720:                    erpc:cast(Cp7, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp6]),
 1721:                    erpc:cast(Cp8, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp7]),
 1722:                    ok
 1723:            end),
 1724: 
 1725:     pong = net_adm:ping(Cp0),
 1726: 
 1727:     wait_for_ready_net(Nodes, Config),
 1728: 
 1729:     %% Just make sure that all nodes have the same picture of all names
 1730:     check_everywhere(Nodes, single_name, Config),
 1731:     assert_pid(global:whereis_name(single_name)),
 1732: 
 1733:     ?UNTIL(begin
 1734:                {Ns2, []} = rpc:multicall(Nodes, erlang, whereis, 
 1735:                                          [single_name]),
 1736:                9 =:= lists:foldl(fun(undefined, N) -> N + 1;
 1737:                                     (_, N) -> N
 1738:                                  end,
 1739:                                  0, Ns2)
 1740:            end),
 1741: 
 1742:     assert_pid(global:send(single_name, die)),
 1743: 
 1744:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 1745: 
 1746:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 1747:     stop_node(Cp0),
 1748:     stop_node(Cp1),
 1749:     stop_node(Cp2),
 1750:     stop_node(Cp3),
 1751:     stop_node(Cp4),
 1752:     stop_node(Cp5),
 1753:     stop_node(Cp6),
 1754:     stop_node(Cp7),
 1755:     stop_node(Cp8),
 1756:     stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr),
 1757:     init_condition(Config),
 1758:     ok.
 1759: 
 1760: %% Simpler version of the ring case.  Used because there are some
 1761: %% distribution problems with many nodes.
 1762: %% Make 6 single nodes, all having the same name.
 1763: %% Make all ping its predecessor, pinging in a ring.
 1764: %% Make sure that there's just one winner.
 1765: simple_ring(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1766:     Timeout = 60,
 1767:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 1768:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 1769:     init_condition(Config),
 1770:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 1771: 
 1772:     Names = [cp0, cp1, cp2, cp3, cp4, cp5],
 1773:     [Cp0, Cp1, Cp2, Cp3, Cp4, Cp5]
 1774: 	= start_nodes(Names, peer, Config),
 1775:     Nodes = lists:sort([node(), Cp0, Cp1, Cp2, Cp3, Cp4, Cp5]),
 1776: 
 1777:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 1778: 
 1779:     PartCtrlr = setup_partitions(Config,
 1780:                                  [[node()], [Cp0], [Cp1], [Cp2], [Cp3],
 1781:                                   [Cp4], [Cp5]]),
 1782:     Time = msec() + 1000,
 1783: 
 1784:     ok = erpc:call(
 1785:            PartCtrlr,
 1786:            fun () ->
 1787:                    erpc:cast(Cp0, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp5]), % ping ourself!
 1788:                    erpc:cast(Cp1, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp0]),
 1789:                    erpc:cast(Cp2, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp1]),
 1790:                    erpc:cast(Cp3, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp2]),
 1791:                    erpc:cast(Cp4, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp3]),
 1792:                    erpc:cast(Cp5, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp4]),
 1793:                    ok
 1794:            end),
 1795: 
 1796:     pong = net_adm:ping(Cp0),
 1797: 
 1798:     wait_for_ready_net(Nodes, Config),
 1799: 
 1800:     %% Just make sure that all nodes have the same picture of all names
 1801:     check_everywhere(Nodes, single_name, Config),
 1802:     assert_pid(global:whereis_name(single_name)),
 1803: 
 1804:     ?UNTIL(begin
 1805:                {Ns2, []} = rpc:multicall(Nodes, erlang, whereis, 
 1806:                                          [single_name]),
 1807:                6 =:= lists:foldl(fun(undefined, N) -> N + 1;
 1808:                                     (_, N) -> N
 1809:                                  end,
 1810:                                  0, Ns2)
 1811:            end),
 1812: 
 1813:     assert_pid(global:send(single_name, die)),
 1814: 
 1815:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 1816: 
 1817:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 1818:     stop_node(Cp0),
 1819:     stop_node(Cp1),
 1820:     stop_node(Cp2),
 1821:     stop_node(Cp3),
 1822:     stop_node(Cp4),
 1823:     stop_node(Cp5),
 1824:     stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr),
 1825:     init_condition(Config),
 1826:     ok.
 1827: 
 1828: %% Make 6 single nodes, all having the same name.
 1829: %% Make all ping its predecessor, pinging in a line.
 1830: %% Make sure that there's just one winner.
 1831: line(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1832:     Timeout = 60,
 1833:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 1834:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 1835:     init_condition(Config),
 1836:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 1837: 
 1838:     [Cp0, Cp1, Cp2, Cp3, Cp4, Cp5, Cp6, Cp7, Cp8]
 1839: 	= start_nodes([cp0, cp1, cp2, cp3, cp4, cp5, cp6, cp7, cp8], 
 1840:                       peer, Config),
 1841:     Nodes = lists:sort([node(), Cp0, Cp1, Cp2, Cp3, Cp4, Cp5, Cp6, Cp7, Cp8]),
 1842: 
 1843:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 1844: 
 1845:     PartCtrlr = setup_partitions(Config,
 1846:                                  [[node()], [Cp0], [Cp1], [Cp2], [Cp3],
 1847:                                   [Cp4], [Cp5], [Cp6], [Cp7], [Cp8]]),
 1848:     ThisNode = node(),
 1849: 
 1850:     Time = msec() + 1000,
 1851:     ok = erpc:call(
 1852:            PartCtrlr,
 1853:            fun () ->
 1854:                    erpc:cast(Cp0, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp0]), % ping ourself!
 1855:                    erpc:cast(Cp1, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp0]),
 1856:                    erpc:cast(Cp2, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp1]),
 1857:                    erpc:cast(Cp3, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp2]),
 1858:                    erpc:cast(Cp4, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp3]),
 1859:                    erpc:cast(Cp5, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp4]),
 1860:                    erpc:cast(Cp6, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp5]),
 1861:                    erpc:cast(Cp7, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp6]),
 1862:                    erpc:cast(Cp8, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp7]),
 1863:                    erpc:cast(ThisNode, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp8]),
 1864:                    ok
 1865:            end),
 1866: 
 1867:     wait_for_ready_net(Nodes, Config),
 1868: 
 1869:     %% Just make sure that all nodes have the same picture of all names
 1870:     check_everywhere(Nodes, single_name, Config),
 1871:     assert_pid(global:whereis_name(single_name)),
 1872: 
 1873:     ?UNTIL(begin
 1874: 	       {Ns2, []} = rpc:multicall(Nodes, erlang, whereis,
 1875: 					 [single_name]),
 1876:  	       9 =:= lists:foldl(fun(undefined, N) -> N + 1;
 1877:                                     (_, N) -> N
 1878:                                  end,
 1879:                                  0, Ns2)
 1880: 	   end),
 1881: 
 1882:     assert_pid(global:send(single_name, die)),
 1883: 
 1884:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 1885: 
 1886:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 1887:     stop_node(Cp0),
 1888:     stop_node(Cp1),
 1889:     stop_node(Cp2),
 1890:     stop_node(Cp3),
 1891:     stop_node(Cp4),
 1892:     stop_node(Cp5),
 1893:     stop_node(Cp6),
 1894:     stop_node(Cp7),
 1895:     stop_node(Cp8),
 1896:     stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr),
 1897:     init_condition(Config),
 1898:     ok.
 1899: 
 1900: 
 1901: %% Simpler version of the line case.  Used because there are some
 1902: %% distribution problems with many nodes.
 1903: %% Make 6 single nodes, all having the same name.
 1904: %% Make all ping its predecessor, pinging in a line.
 1905: %% Make sure that there's just one winner.
 1906: simple_line(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1907:     Timeout = 60,
 1908:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 1909:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 1910:     init_condition(Config),
 1911:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 1912: 
 1913:     [Cp0, Cp1, Cp2, Cp3, Cp4, Cp5]
 1914: 	= start_nodes([cp0, cp1, cp2, cp3, cp4, cp5], peer, Config),
 1915:     Nodes = lists:sort([node(), Cp0, Cp1, Cp2, Cp3, Cp4, Cp5]),
 1916: 
 1917:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 1918: 
 1919:     PartCtrlr = setup_partitions(Config,
 1920:                                  [[node()], [Cp0], [Cp1], [Cp2], [Cp3],
 1921:                                   [Cp4], [Cp5]]),
 1922:     ThisNode = node(),
 1923: 
 1924:     Time = msec() + 1000,
 1925:     ok = erpc:call(
 1926:            PartCtrlr,
 1927:            fun () ->
 1928:                    erpc:cast(Cp0, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp0]), % ping ourself!
 1929:                    erpc:cast(Cp1, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp0]),
 1930:                    erpc:cast(Cp2, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp1]),
 1931:                    erpc:cast(Cp3, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp2]),
 1932:                    erpc:cast(Cp4, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp3]),
 1933:                    erpc:cast(Cp5, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp4]),
 1934:                    erpc:cast(ThisNode, ?MODULE, single_node, [Time, Cp5]),
 1935:                    ok
 1936:            end),
 1937: 
 1938:     wait_for_ready_net(Nodes, Config),
 1939: 
 1940:     %% Just make sure that all nodes have the same picture of all names
 1941:     check_everywhere(Nodes, single_name, Config),
 1942:     assert_pid(global:whereis_name(single_name)),
 1943: 
 1944:     ?UNTIL(begin
 1945: 	       {Ns2, []} = rpc:multicall(Nodes, erlang, whereis,
 1946: 					 [single_name]),
 1947:  	       6 =:= lists:foldl(fun(undefined, N) -> N + 1;
 1948:                                     (_, N) -> N
 1949:                                  end,
 1950:                                  0, Ns2)
 1951: 	   end),
 1952: 
 1953:     assert_pid(global:send(single_name, die)),
 1954: 
 1955:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 1956: 
 1957:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 1958:     stop_node(Cp0),
 1959:     stop_node(Cp1),
 1960:     stop_node(Cp2),
 1961:     stop_node(Cp3),
 1962:     stop_node(Cp4),
 1963:     stop_node(Cp5),
 1964:     stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr),
 1965:     init_condition(Config),
 1966:     ok.
 1967: 
 1968: %% Test ticket: Global should keep track of all pids that set the same lock.
 1969: otp_1849(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1970:     Timeout = 30,
 1971:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 1972:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 1973:     init_condition(Config),
 1974:     {ok, Cp1} = start_node(cp1, Config),
 1975:     {ok, Cp2} = start_node(cp2, Config),
 1976:     {ok, Cp3} = start_node(cp3, Config),
 1977: 
 1978:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 1979: 
 1980:     %% start procs on each node
 1981:     Pid1 = rpc:call(Cp1, ?MODULE, start_proc, []),
 1982:     assert_pid(Pid1),
 1983:     Pid2 = rpc:call(Cp2, ?MODULE, start_proc, []),
 1984:     assert_pid(Pid2),
 1985:     Pid3 = rpc:call(Cp3, ?MODULE, start_proc, []),
 1986:     assert_pid(Pid3),
 1987: 
 1988:     %% set a lock on every node
 1989:     true = req(Pid1, {set_lock2, {test_lock, ?MODULE}, self()}),
 1990:     true = req(Pid2, {set_lock2, {test_lock, ?MODULE}, self()}),
 1991:     true = req(Pid3, {set_lock2, {test_lock, ?MODULE}, self()}),
 1992: 
 1993:     ?UNTIL(begin
 1994:                [{test_lock, ?MODULE, Lock1}] = 
 1995:                    rpc:call(Cp1, ets, tab2list, [global_locks]),
 1996:                3 =:= length(Lock1)
 1997:            end),
 1998: 
 1999:     true = req(Pid3, {del_lock2, {test_lock, ?MODULE}, self()}),
 2000:     ?UNTIL(begin
 2001:                [{test_lock, ?MODULE, Lock2}] = 
 2002:                    rpc:call(Cp1, ets, tab2list, [global_locks]),
 2003:                2 =:= length(Lock2)
 2004:            end),
 2005: 
 2006:     true = req(Pid2, {del_lock2, {test_lock, ?MODULE}, self()}),
 2007:     ?UNTIL(begin
 2008:                [{test_lock, ?MODULE, Lock3}] = 
 2009:                    rpc:call(Cp1, ets, tab2list, [global_locks]),
 2010:                1 =:= length(Lock3)
 2011:            end),
 2012: 
 2013:     true = req(Pid1, {del_lock2, {test_lock, ?MODULE}, self()}),
 2014:     ?UNTIL([] =:= rpc:call(Cp1, ets, tab2list, [global_locks])),
 2015: 
 2016:
