 2017:     true = req(Pid1, {set_lock2, {test_lock, ?MODULE}, self()}),
 2018:     true = req(Pid2, {set_lock2, {test_lock, ?MODULE}, self()}),
 2019:     true = req(Pid3, {set_lock2, {test_lock, ?MODULE}, self()}),
 2020:     false = req(Pid2, {set_lock2, {test_lock, not_valid}, self()}),
 2021: 
 2022:     exit_p(Pid1),
 2023:     ?UNTIL(begin
 2024:                [{test_lock, ?MODULE, Lock10}] = 
 2025:                    rpc:call(Cp1, ets, tab2list, [global_locks]),
 2026:                2 =:= length(Lock10)
 2027:            end),
 2028:     ?UNTIL(begin
 2029:                [{test_lock, ?MODULE, Lock11}] = 
 2030:                    rpc:call(Cp2, ets, tab2list, [global_locks]),
 2031:                2 =:= length(Lock11)
 2032:            end),
 2033:     ?UNTIL(begin
 2034:                [{test_lock, ?MODULE, Lock12}] = 
 2035:                    rpc:call(Cp3, ets, tab2list, [global_locks]),
 2036:                2 =:= length(Lock12)
 2037:            end),
 2038: 
 2039:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 2040:     stop_node(Cp1),
 2041:     stop_node(Cp2),
 2042:     stop_node(Cp3),
 2043:     init_condition(Config),
 2044:     ok.
 2045: 
 2046: 
 2047: %% Test ticket: Deadlock in global.
 2048: otp_3162(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2049:     StartFun = fun() ->
 2050:                        {ok, Cp1} = start_node(cp1, peer, Config),
 2051:                        {ok, Cp2} = start_node(cp2, peer, Config),
 2052:                        {ok, Cp3} = start_node(cp3, peer, Config),
 2053:                        [Cp1, Cp2, Cp3]
 2054:                end,
 2055:     do_otp_3162(StartFun, Config).
 2056: 
 2057: do_otp_3162(StartFun, Config) ->
 2058:     Timeout = 30,
 2059:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 2060:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 2061:     init_condition(Config),
 2062:     [Cp1, Cp2, Cp3] = StartFun(),
 2063: 
 2064:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 2065: 
 2066:     ThisNode = node(),
 2067: 
 2068:     PartCntrlr = setup_partitions(Config, [[ThisNode, Cp1, Cp2, Cp3]]),
 2069: 
 2070:     %% start procs on each node
 2071:     Pid1 = rpc:call(Cp1, ?MODULE, start_proc4, [kalle]),
 2072:     assert_pid(Pid1),
 2073:     Pid2 = rpc:call(Cp2, ?MODULE, start_proc4, [stina]),
 2074:     assert_pid(Pid2),
 2075:     Pid3 = rpc:call(Cp3, ?MODULE, start_proc4, [vera]),
 2076:     assert_pid(Pid3),
 2077: 
 2078:     disconnect_nodes(PartCntrlr, Cp1, Cp2),
 2079:     %% Nowadays we do not know how the net have been partitioned after the
 2080:     %% disconnect, so we cannot perform all the tests this testcase originally
 2081:     %% did. We instead only test the end result is ok after we have reconnected
 2082:     %% all nodes.
 2083: 
 2084:     erpc:call(PartCntrlr,
 2085:               fun () ->
 2086:                       erpc:cast(Cp1, net_kernel, connect_node, [Cp3]),
 2087:                       erpc:cast(Cp2, net_kernel, connect_node, [Cp3]),
 2088:                       erpc:cast(ThisNode, net_kernel, connect_node, [Cp3])
 2089:               end),
 2090: 
 2091:     ?UNTIL(lists:sort([ThisNode, Cp1, Cp2]) =:=
 2092:                lists:sort(erpc:call(Cp3, erlang, nodes, []))),
 2093:     ?UNTIL([kalle, stina, vera] =:=
 2094: 	       lists:sort(erpc:call(Cp3, global, registered_names, []))),
 2095: 
 2096:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 2097:     stop_node(Cp1),
 2098:     stop_node(Cp2),
 2099:     stop_node(Cp3),
 2100:     stop_partition_controller(PartCntrlr),
 2101:     init_condition(Config),
 2102:     ok.
 2103: 
 2104: 
 2105: %% OTP-5640. 'allow' multiple names for registered processes.
 2106: otp_5640(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2107:     Timeout = 25,
 2108:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 2109:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 2110:     init_condition(Config),
 2111:     {ok, B} = start_node(b, Config),
 2112: 
 2113:     Nodes = lists:sort([node(), B]),
 2114:     wait_for_ready_net(Nodes, Config),
 2115: 
 2116:     Server = whereis(global_name_server),
 2117:     ServerB = rpc:call(B, erlang, whereis, [global_name_server]),
 2118: 
 2119:     Me = self(),
 2120:     Proc = spawn(fun() -> otp_5640_proc(Me) end),
 2121: 
 2122:     yes = global:register_name(name1, Proc),
 2123:     no = global:register_name(name2, Proc),
 2124: 
 2125:     ok = application:set_env(kernel, global_multi_name_action, allow),
 2126:     yes = global:register_name(name2, Proc),
 2127: 
 2128:     ct:sleep(100),
 2129:     Proc = global:whereis_name(name1),
 2130:     Proc = global:whereis_name(name2),
 2131:     check_everywhere(Nodes, name1, Config),
 2132:     check_everywhere(Nodes, name2, Config),
 2133: 
 2134:     {monitors_2levels, MonBy1} = mon_by_servers(Proc),
 2135:     [] = ([Server,Server,ServerB,ServerB] -- MonBy1),
 2136:     {links,[]} = process_info(Proc, links),
 2137:     _ = global:unregister_name(name1),
 2138: 
 2139:     ct:sleep(100),
 2140:     undefined = global:whereis_name(name1),
 2141:     Proc = global:whereis_name(name2),
 2142:     check_everywhere(Nodes, name1, Config),
 2143:     check_everywhere(Nodes, name2, Config),
 2144: 
 2145:     {monitors_2levels, MonBy2} = mon_by_servers(Proc),
 2146:     [] = ([Server,ServerB] -- MonBy2),
 2147:     TmpMonBy2 = MonBy2 -- [Server,ServerB],
 2148:     TmpMonBy2 = TmpMonBy2 -- [Server,ServerB],
 2149:     {links,[]} = process_info(Proc, links),
 2150: 
 2151:     yes = global:register_name(name1, Proc),
 2152: 
 2153:     Proc ! die,
 2154: 
 2155:     ct:sleep(100),
 2156:     undefined = global:whereis_name(name1),
 2157:     undefined = global:whereis_name(name2),
 2158:     check_everywhere(Nodes, name1, Config),
 2159:     check_everywhere(Nodes, name2, Config),
 2160:     {monitors, GMonitors} = process_info(Server, monitors),
 2161:     false = lists:member({process, Proc}, GMonitors),
 2162: 
 2163:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 2164:     stop_node(B),
 2165:     init_condition(Config),
 2166:     ok.
 2167: 
 2168: otp_5640_proc(_Parent) ->
 2169:     receive 
 2170:         die ->
 2171:             exit(normal)
 2172:     end.
 2173: 
 2174: %% OTP-5737. set_lock/3 and trans/4 accept Retries = 0.
 2175: otp_5737(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2176:     Timeout = 25,
 2177:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 2178:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 2179:     init_condition(Config),
 2180: 
 2181:     LockId = {?MODULE,self()},
 2182:     Nodes = [node()],
 2183:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch global:set_lock(LockId, Nodes, -1)),
 2184:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch global:set_lock(LockId, Nodes, a)),
 2185:     true = global:set_lock(LockId, Nodes, 0),
 2186:     Time1 = erlang:timestamp(),
 2187:     false = global:set_lock({?MODULE,not_me}, Nodes, 0),
 2188:     true = timer:now_diff(erlang:timestamp(), Time1) < 5000,
 2189:     _ = global:del_lock(LockId, Nodes),
 2190: 
 2191:     Fun = fun() -> ok end,
 2192:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch global:trans(LockId, Fun, Nodes, -1)),
 2193:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch global:trans(LockId, Fun, Nodes, a)),
 2194:     ok = global:trans(LockId, Fun, Nodes, 0),
 2195: 
 2196:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 2197:     init_condition(Config),
 2198:     ok.
 2199: 
 2200: connect_all_false(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2201:     %% OTP-6931. Ignore nodeup when connect_all=false.
 2202:     connect_all_false_test("-connect_all false", Config),
 2203:     %% OTP-17934: multiple -connect_all false and kernel parameter connect_all
 2204:     connect_all_false_test("-connect_all false -connect_all false", Config),
 2205:     connect_all_false_test("-kernel connect_all false", Config),
 2206:     ok.
 2207: 
 2208: connect_all_false_test(CAArg, Config) ->
 2209:     Me = self(),
 2210:     {ok, CAf} = start_non_connecting_node(ca_false, Config),
 2211:     {ok, false} = rpc:call(CAf, application, get_env, [kernel, connect_all]),
 2212:     ok = rpc:call(CAf, error_logger, add_report_handler, [?MODULE, Me]),
 2213:     info = rpc:call(CAf, error_logger, warning_map, []),
 2214:     {global_name_server,CAf} ! {nodeup, fake_node, #{connection_id => 4711}},
 2215:     timer:sleep(100),
 2216:     stop_node(CAf),
 2217:     receive {nodeup,fake_node, _} ->
 2218:             ct:fail({info_report, was, sent})
 2219:     after 1000 -> ok
 2220:     end,
 2221:     ok.
 2222: 
 2223: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 2224: %%% Testing a disconnected node. Not two partitions.
 2225: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 2226: %% OTP-5563. Disconnected nodes (not partitions).
 2227: simple_disconnect(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2228:     Timeout = 30,
 2229:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 2230:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 2231:     init_condition(Config),
 2232:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 2233: 
 2234:     %% Three nodes (test_server, n_1, n_2). 
 2235:     [Cp1, Cp2] = Cps = start_nodes([n_1, n_2], peer, Config),
 2236:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 2237: 
 2238:     PartCtrlr = start_partition_controller(Config),
 2239: 
 2240:     Nodes = lists:sort([node() | Cps]),
 2241: 
 2242:     lists:foreach(fun(N) -> rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, start_tracer, []) end,Nodes),
 2243: 
 2244:     Name = name,
 2245:     Resolver = {no_module, resolve_none}, % will never be called
 2246:     PingNode = Cp2,
 2247: 
 2248:     {_Pid1, yes} =
 2249:         rpc:call(Cp1, ?MODULE, start_resolver, [Name, Resolver]),
 2250:     ct:sleep(100),
 2251: 
 2252:     %% Disconnect test_server and Cp2. 
 2253:     disconnect_nodes(PartCtrlr, node(), Cp2),
 2254:     %% We might have been disconnected from Cp1 as well. Ensure connected
 2255:     %% to Cp1...
 2256:     pong = net_adm:ping(Cp1),
 2257: 
 2258:     %% _Pid is registered on Cp1. The exchange of names between Cp2 and
 2259:     %% test_server sees two identical pids.
 2260:     pong = net_adm:ping(PingNode),
 2261: 
 2262:     ?UNTIL(Cps =:= lists:sort(nodes())),
 2263: 
 2264:     {_, Trace0} = collect_tracers(Nodes),
 2265:     Resolvers = [P || {_Node,new_resolver,{pid,P}} <- Trace0],
 2266:     check_everywhere(Nodes, Name, Config),
 2267:     true = undefined /= global:whereis_name(Name),
 2268:     lists:foreach(fun(P) -> P ! die end, Resolvers),
 2269:     lists:foreach(fun(P) -> wait_for_exit(P) end, Resolvers),
 2270:     check_everywhere(Nodes, Name, Config),
 2271:     undefined = global:whereis_name(Name),
 2272: 
 2273:     {_, Trace1} = collect_tracers(Nodes),
 2274:     Trace = Trace0 ++ Trace1, 
 2275:     [] = [foo || {_, resolve_none, _, _} <- Trace],
 2276: 
 2277:     Gs = name_servers(Nodes),
 2278:     [_, _, _] = monitored_by_node(Trace, Gs),
 2279: 
 2280:     lists:foreach(fun(N) -> rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, stop_tracer, []) end, Nodes),
 2281: 
 2282:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 2283:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 2284:     stop_nodes(Cps),
 2285:     stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr),
 2286:     init_condition(Config),
 2287:     ok.
 2288: 
 2289: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 2290: %%% Testing resolve of name. Many combinations with four nodes.
 2291: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 2292: -record(cf, {
 2293:           link,  % node expected to have registered process running
 2294:           ping,  % node in partition 2 to be pinged
 2295:           n1,    % node starting registered process in partition 1
 2296:           n2,    % node starting registered process in partition 2
 2297:           nodes, % nodes expected to exist after ping
 2298:           n_res, % expected number of resolvers after ping
 2299:           config,
 2300:           ctrlr
 2301:          }).
 2302: 
 2303: -define(RES(F), {F, fun ?MODULE:F/3}).
 2304: 
 2305: %% OTP-5563. Partitions and names.
 2306: simple_resolve(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2307:     Timeout = 360,
 2308:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 2309:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 2310:     init_condition(Config),
 2311:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 2312: 
 2313:     [N1, A2, Z2] = Cps = start_nodes([n_1, a_2, z_2], peer, Config),
 2314:     Nodes = lists:sort([node() | Cps]),
 2315:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 2316: 
 2317:     PartCtrlr = start_partition_controller(Config),
 2318: 
 2319:     lists:foreach(fun(N) -> 
 2320:                           rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, start_tracer, [])
 2321:                   end, Nodes),
 2322: 
 2323:     %% There used to be a link between global_name_server and the
 2324:     %% registered name. Now there are only monitors, but the field
 2325:     %% name 'link' remains...
 2326: 
 2327:     Cf = #cf{link = none, ping = A2, n1 = node(), n2 = A2,
 2328:              nodes = [node(), N1, A2, Z2], n_res = 2, config = Config,
 2329:              ctrlr = PartCtrlr},
 2330: 
 2331:     %% There is no test with a resolver that deletes a pid (like
 2332:     %% global_exit_name does). The resulting DOWN signal just clears
 2333:     %% out the pid from the tables, which should be harmless. So all
 2334:     %% tests are done with resolvers that keep both processes. This
 2335:     %% should catch all cases which used to result in bogus process
 2336:     %% links (now: only monitors are used).
 2337: 
 2338:     %% Two partitions are created in each case below: [node(), n_1]
 2339:     %% and [a_2, z_2]. A name ('name') is registered in both
 2340:     %% partitions whereafter node() or n_1 pings a_2 or z_2. Note that
 2341:     %% node() = test_server, which means that node() < z_2 and node()
 2342:     %% > a_2. The lesser node calls the resolver.
 2343: 
 2344:     %% [The following comment does not apply now that monitors are used.]
 2345:     %% The resolver is run on a_2 with the process on node()
 2346:     %% as first argument. The process registered as 'name' on a_2 is
 2347:     %% removed from the tables. It is unlinked from a_2, and the new
 2348:     %% process (on node()) is inserted without trying to link to it
 2349:     %% (it it known to run on some other node, in the other
 2350:     %% partition). The new process is not sent to the other partition
 2351:     %% for update since it already exists there.
 2352:     res(?RES(resolve_first), Cps, Cf#cf{link = node(), n2 = A2}),
 2353:     %% The same, but the z_2 takes the place of a_2.
 2354:     res(?RES(resolve_first), Cps, Cf#cf{link = node(), n2 = Z2}),
 2355:     %% The resolver is run on test_server. 
 2356:     res(?RES(resolve_first), Cps, Cf#cf{link = A2, n2 = A2, ping = Z2}),
 2357:     res(?RES(resolve_first), Cps, Cf#cf{link = Z2, n2 = Z2, ping = Z2}),
 2358:     %% Now the same tests but with n_1 taking the place of test_server.
 2359:     res(?RES(resolve_first), Cps, Cf#cf{link = N1, n1 = N1, n2 = A2}),
 2360:     res(?RES(resolve_first), Cps, Cf#cf{link = N1, n1 = N1, n2 = Z2}),
 2361:     res(?RES(resolve_first), Cps, Cf#cf{link = A2, n1 = N1, n2 = A2, ping = Z2}),
 2362:     res(?RES(resolve_first), Cps, Cf#cf{link = Z2, n1 = N1, n2 = Z2, ping = Z2}),
 2363: 
 2364:     %% [Maybe this set of tests is the same as (ismorphic to?) the last one.]
 2365:     %% The resolver is run on a_2 with the process on node()
 2366:     %% as first argument. The process registered as 'name' on a_2 is
 2367:     %% the one kept. The old process is unlinked on node(), and the
 2368:     %% new process (on a_2) is inserted without trying to link to it
 2369:     %% (it it known to run on some other node).
 2370:     res(?RES(resolve_second), Cps, Cf#cf{link = A2, n2 = A2}),
 2371:     %% The same, but the z_2 takes the place of a_2.
 2372:     res(?RES(resolve_second), Cps, Cf#cf{link = Z2, n2 = Z2}),
 2373:     %% The resolver is run on test_server. 
 2374:     res(?RES(resolve_second), Cps, Cf#cf{link = node(), n2 = A2, ping = Z2}),
 2375:     res(?RES(resolve_second), Cps, Cf#cf{link = node(), n2 = Z2, ping = Z2}),
 2376:     %% Now the same tests but with n_1 taking the place of test_server.
 2377:     res(?RES(resolve_second), Cps, Cf#cf{link = A2, n1 = N1, n2 = A2}),
 2378:     res(?RES(resolve_second), Cps, Cf#cf{link = Z2, n1 = N1, n2 = Z2}),
 2379:     res(?RES(resolve_second), Cps, Cf#cf{link = N1, n1 = N1, n2 = A2, ping = Z2}),
 2380:     res(?RES(resolve_second), Cps, Cf#cf{link = N1, n1 = N1, n2 = Z2, ping = Z2}),
 2381: 
 2382:     %% A resolver that does not return one of the pids.
 2383:     res(?RES(bad_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{n2 = A2}),
 2384:     res(?RES(bad_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{n2 = Z2}),
 2385:     %% The resolver is run on test_server. 
 2386:     res(?RES(bad_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{n2 = A2, ping = Z2}),
 2387:     res(?RES(bad_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{n2 = Z2, ping = Z2}),
 2388:     %% Now the same tests but with n_1 taking the place of test_server.
 2389:     res(?RES(bad_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{n1 = N1, n2 = A2}),
 2390:     res(?RES(bad_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{n1 = N1, n2 = Z2}),
 2391:     res(?RES(bad_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{n1 = N1, n2 = A2, ping = Z2}),
 2392:     res(?RES(bad_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{n1 = N1, n2 = Z2, ping = Z2}),
 2393: 
 2394:     %% Both processes are unlinked (demonitored).
 2395:     res(?RES(resolve_none), Cps, Cf#cf{n2 = A2}),
 2396:     res(?RES(resolve_none), Cps, Cf#cf{n2 = Z2}),
 2397:     res(?RES(resolve_none), Cps, Cf#cf{n2 = A2, ping = Z2}),
 2398:     res(?RES(resolve_none), Cps, Cf#cf{n2 = Z2, ping = Z2}),
 2399:     res(?RES(resolve_none), Cps, Cf#cf{n1 = N1, n2 = A2}),
 2400:     res(?RES(resolve_none), Cps, Cf#cf{n1 = N1, n2 = Z2}),
 2401:     res(?RES(resolve_none), Cps, Cf#cf{n1 = N1, n2 = A2, ping = Z2}),
 2402:     res(?RES(resolve_none), Cps, Cf#cf{n1 = N1, n2 = Z2, ping = Z2}),
 2403: 
 2404:     %% A resolver faking badrpc. The resolver is run on a_2, and the
 2405:     %% process on node() is kept.
 2406:     res(?RES(badrpc_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{link = node(), n2 = A2}),
 2407: 
 2408:     %% An exiting resolver. A kind of badrpc.
 2409:     res(?RES(exit_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{link = node(), n2 = A2}),
 2410:     res(?RES(exit_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{link = node(), n2 = Z2}),
 2411:     res(?RES(exit_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{link = A2, n2 = A2, ping = Z2}),
 2412:     res(?RES(exit_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{link = Z2, n2 = Z2, ping = Z2}),
 2413:     res(?RES(exit_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{link = N1, n1 = N1, n2 = A2}),
 2414:     res(?RES(exit_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{link = N1, n1 = N1, n2 = Z2}),
 2415:     res(?RES(exit_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{link = A2, n1 = N1, n2 = A2, ping = Z2}),
 2416:     res(?RES(exit_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{link = Z2, n1 = N1, n2 = Z2, ping = Z2}),
 2417: 
 2418:     %% A locker that takes a lock. It used to be that the
 2419:     %% global_name_server was busy exchanging names, which caused a
 2420:     %% deadlock.
 2421:     res(?RES(lock_resolver), Cps, Cf#cf{link = node()}),
 2422: 
 2423:     %% A resolver that disconnects from the node of the first pid
 2424:     %% once. The nodedown message is processed (the resolver killed),
 2425:     %% then a new attempt (nodeup etc.) is made. This time the
 2426:     %% resolver does not disconnect any node.
 2427:     res(?RES(disconnect_first), Cps, Cf#cf{link = Z2, n2 = Z2,
 2428: 					   nodes = [node(), N1, A2, Z2]}),
 2429: 
 2430:     lists:foreach(fun(N) ->
 2431: 			  rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, stop_tracer, [])
 2432: 		  end, Nodes),
 2433: 
 2434:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 2435:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 2436:     stop_nodes(Cps),
 2437:     stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr),
 2438:     init_condition(Config),
 2439:     ok.
 2440: 
 2441: %% OTP-5563. Partitions and names.
 2442: simple_resolve2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2443:     %% Continuation of simple_resolve. Of some reason it did not
 2444:     %% always work to re-start z_2. "Cannot be a global bug."
 2445: 
 2446:     Timeout = 30,
 2447:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 2448:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 2449:     init_condition(Config),
 2450:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 2451: 
 2452:     [N1, A2, Z2] = Cps = start_nodes([n_1, a_2, z_2], peer, Config),
 2453:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 2454:     Nodes = lists:sort([node() | Cps]),
 2455: 
 2456:     PartCtrlr = start_partition_controller(Config),
 2457: 
 2458:     lists:foreach(fun(N) -> 
 2459:                           rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, start_tracer, [])
 2460:                   end, Nodes),
 2461: 
 2462:     Cf = #cf{link = none, ping = A2, n1 = node(), n2 = A2,
 2463:              nodes = [node(), N1, A2, Z2], n_res = 2, config = Config,
 2464:              ctrlr = PartCtrlr},
 2465: 
 2466:     %% Halt z_2. 
 2467:     res(?RES(halt_second), Cps, Cf#cf{link = N1, n1 = N1, n2 = Z2, ping  = A2,
 2468: 				      nodes = [node(), N1, A2], n_res = 1}),
 2469: 
 2470:     lists:foreach(fun(N) ->
 2471: 			  rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, stop_tracer, [])
 2472: 		  end, Nodes),
 2473: 
 2474:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 2475:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 2476:     stop_nodes(Cps), % Not all nodes may be present, but it works anyway.
 2477:     stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr),
 2478:     init_condition(Config),
 2479:     ok.
 2480: 
 2481: %% OTP-5563. Partitions and names.
 2482: simple_resolve3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2483:     %% Continuation of simple_resolve.
 2484: 
 2485:     Timeout = 30,
 2486:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 2487:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 2488:     init_condition(Config),
 2489:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 2490: 
 2491:     [N1, A2, Z2] = Cps = start_nodes([n_1, a_2, z_2], peer, Config),
 2492:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 2493:     Nodes = lists:sort([node() | Cps]),
 2494: 
 2495:     PartCtrlr = start_partition_controller(Config),
 2496: 
 2497:     lists:foreach(fun(N) -> 
 2498:                           rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, start_tracer, [])
 2499:                   end, Nodes),
 2500: 
 2501:     Cf = #cf{link = none, ping = A2, n1 = node(), n2 = A2,
 2502:              nodes = [node(), N1, A2, Z2], n_res = 2, config = Config,
 2503:              ctrlr = PartCtrlr},
 2504: 
 2505:     %% Halt a_2. 
 2506:     res(?RES(halt_second), Cps, Cf#cf{link = node(), n2 = A2, 
 2507:                                       nodes = [node(), N1], n_res = 1}),
 2508: 
 2509:     lists:foreach(fun(N) ->
 2510: 			  rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, stop_tracer, [])
 2511: 		  end, Nodes),
 2512: 
 2513:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 2514:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 2515:     stop_nodes(Cps), % Not all nodes may be present, but it works anyway.
 2516:     stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr),
 2517:     init_condition(Config),
 2518:     ok.
 2519: 
 2520: res({Res,Resolver}, [N1, A2, Z2], Cf) ->
 2521:     %% Note: there are no links anymore, but monitors.
 2522:     #cf{link = LinkedNode, ping = PingNode, n1 = Res1, n2 = OtherNode,
 2523:         nodes = Nodes0, n_res = NRes, config = Config, ctrlr = PartCtrlr} = Cf,
 2524:     io:format("~n~nResolver: ~p", [Res]),
 2525:     io:format(" Registered on partition 1:  ~p", [Res1]),
 2526:     io:format(" Registered on partition 2:  ~p", [OtherNode]),
 2527:     io:format(" Pinged node:                ~p", [PingNode]),
 2528:     io:format(" Linked node:                ~p", [LinkedNode]),
 2529:     io:format(" Expected # resolvers:       ~p", [NRes]),
 2530:     Nodes = lists:sort(Nodes0),
 2531:     T1 = node(),
 2532:     Part1 = [T1, N1],
 2533:     Part2 = [A2, Z2],
 2534:     Name = name,
 2535: 
 2536:     %% A registered name is resolved in different scenarios with just
 2537:     %% four nodes. In each scenario it is checked that exactly the
 2538:     %% expected monitors remain between registered processes and the
 2539:     %% global_name_server.
 2540: 
 2541:     setup_partitions(PartCtrlr, [Part1, Part2]),
 2542: 
 2543:     erpc:call(PartCtrlr,
 2544:               fun () ->
 2545:                       erpc:call(OtherNode,
 2546:                                 fun () ->
 2547:                                         {Pid2, yes} = start_resolver(Name,
 2548:                                                                      Resolver),
 2549:                                         trace_message({node(), part_2_2,
 2550:                                                        nodes(), {pid2,Pid2}})
 2551:                                 end)
 2552:               end),
 2553: 
 2554:     {_Pid1, yes} =
 2555:         rpc:call(Res1, ?MODULE, start_resolver, [Name, Resolver]),
 2556: 
 2557:     pong = net_adm:ping(PingNode),
 2558:     wait_for_ready_net(Nodes, Config),
 2559: 
 2560:     check_everywhere(Nodes, Name, Config),
 2561:     case global:whereis_name(Name) of
 2562: 	undefined when LinkedNode =:= none -> ok;
 2563: 	Pid -> assert_pid(Pid)
 2564:     end,
 2565: 
 2566:     {_, Trace0} = collect_tracers(Nodes),
 2567:     Resolvers = [P || {_Node,new_resolver,{pid,P}} <- Trace0],
 2568: 
 2569:     NRes = length(Resolvers),
 2570: 
 2571:     %% Wait for extra monitor processes to be created.
 2572:     %% This applies as long as global:do_monitor/1 spawns processes.
 2573:     %% (Some day monitor() will be truly synchronous.)
 2574:     ct:sleep(100),
 2575: 
 2576:     lists:foreach(fun(P) -> P ! die end, Resolvers),
 2577:     lists:foreach(fun(P) -> wait_for_exit(P) end, Resolvers),
 2578: 
 2579:     check_everywhere(Nodes, Name, Config),
 2580:     undefined = global:whereis_name(Name),
 2581: 
 2582:     %% Wait for monitors to remove names.
 2583:     ct:sleep(100),
 2584: 
 2585:     {_, Trace1} = collect_tracers(Nodes),
 2586:     Trace = Trace0 ++ Trace1, 
 2587: 
 2588:     Gs = name_servers([T1, N1, A2, Z2]),
 2589:     MonitoredByNode = monitored_by_node(Trace, Gs),
 2590:     MonitoredBy = [M || {_N,M} <- MonitoredByNode],
 2591: 
 2592:     X = MonitoredBy -- Gs,
 2593:     LengthGs = length(Gs),
 2594:     case MonitoredBy of
 2595: 	[] when LinkedNode =:= none -> ok;
 2596: 	Gs -> ok;
 2597: 	_ when LengthGs < 4, X =:= [] -> ok;
 2598: 	_ -> io:format("ERROR:~nMonitoredBy ~p~n"
 2599: 		       "global_name_servers ~p~n",
 2600: 		       [MonitoredByNode, Gs]),
 2601: 	     ct:fail(monitor_mismatch)
 2602:     end,
 2603:     ok.
 2604: 
 2605: name_servers(Nodes) ->
 2606:     lists:sort([rpc:call(N, erlang, whereis, [global_name_server]) || 
 2607:                    N <- Nodes,
 2608:                    pong =:= net_adm:ping(N)]).
 2609: 
 2610: monitored_by_node(Trace, Servers) ->
 2611:     lists:sort([{node(M),M} || 
 2612:                    {_Node,_P,died,{monitors_2levels,ML}} <- Trace, 
 2613:                    M <- ML,
 2614:                    lists:member(M, Servers)]).
 2615: 
 2616: resolve_first(name, Pid1, _Pid2) ->
 2617:     Pid1.
 2618: 
 2619: resolve_second(name, _Pid1, Pid2) ->
 2620:     Pid2.
 2621: 
 2622: resolve_none(name, _Pid1, _Pid2) ->
 2623:     none.
 2624: 
 2625: bad_resolver(name, _Pid1, _Pid2) ->
 2626:     bad_answer.
 2627: 
 2628: badrpc_resolver(name, _Pid1, _Pid2) ->
 2629:     {badrpc, badrpc}.
 2630: 
 2631: exit_resolver(name, _Pid1, _Pid2) ->
 2632:     erlang:error(bad_resolver).
 2633: 
 2634: lock_resolver(name, Pid1, _Pid2) ->
 2635:     Id = {?MODULE, self()},
 2636:     Nodes = [node()],
 2637:     true = global:set_lock(Id, Nodes),
 2638:     _ = global:del_lock(Id, Nodes),
 2639:     Pid1.
 2640: 
 2641: disconnect_first(name, Pid1, Pid2) ->
 2642:     Name = disconnect_first_name,
 2643:     case whereis(Name) of
 2644:         undefined -> 
 2645:             spawn(fun() -> disconnect_first_name(Name) end),
 2646:             true = erlang:disconnect_node(node(Pid1));
 2647:         Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
 2648:             Pid ! die
 2649:     end,
 2650:     Pid2.
 2651: 
 2652: disconnect_first_name(Name) ->
 2653:     register(Name, self()),
 2654:     receive die -> ok end.
 2655: 
 2656: halt_second(name, _Pid1, Pid2) ->
 2657:     rpc:call(node(Pid2), erlang, halt, []),
 2658:     Pid2.
 2659: 
 2660: start_resolver(Name, Resolver) ->
 2661:     Self = self(), 
 2662:     Pid = spawn(fun() -> init_resolver(Self, Name, Resolver) end),
 2663:     trace_message({node(), new_resolver, {pid, Pid}}),
 2664:     receive
 2665: 	{Pid, Res} -> {Pid, Res}
 2666:     end.
 2667: 
 2668: init_resolver(Parent, Name, Resolver) ->
 2669:     X = global:register_name(Name, self(), Resolver),
 2670:     Parent ! {self(), X},
 2671:     loop_resolver().
 2672: 
 2673: loop_resolver() ->
 2674:     receive
 2675:         die ->
 2676:             trace_message({node(), self(), died, mon_by_servers(self())}),
 2677:             exit(normal)
 2678:     end.
 2679: 
 2680: %% The server sometimes uses an extra process for monitoring. 
 2681: %% The server monitors that extra process.
 2682: mon_by_servers(Proc) ->
 2683:     {monitored_by, ML} = process_info(Proc, monitored_by),
 2684:     {monitors_2levels, 
 2685:      lists:append([ML | 
 2686:                    [begin
 2687:                         {monitored_by, MML} = rpc:call(node(M), 
 2688:                                                        erlang, 
 2689:                                                        process_info, 
 2690:                                                        [M, monitored_by]),
 2691:                         MML
 2692:                     end || M <- ML]])}.
 2693: 
 2694: -define(REGNAME, contact_a_2).
 2695: 
 2696: %% OTP-5563. Bug: nodedown while syncing.
 2697: leftover_name(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2698:     Timeout = 30,
 2699:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 2700:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 2701:     init_condition(Config),
 2702:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 2703:     [N1, A2, Z2] = Cps = start_nodes([n_1, a_2, z_2], peer,  Config),
 2704:     Nodes = lists:sort([node() | Cps]),
 2705:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 2706: 
 2707:     lists:foreach(fun(N) -> 
 2708:                           rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, start_tracer, [])
 2709:                   end, Nodes),
 2710: 
 2711:     Name = name, % registered on a_2
 2712:     ResName = resolved_name, % registered on n_1 and a_2
 2713:     %% 
 2714:     _Pid = ping_a_2_fun(?REGNAME, N1, A2),
 2715: 
 2716:     T1 = node(),
 2717:     Part1 = [T1, N1],
 2718:     Part2 = [A2, Z2],
 2719:     NoResolver = {no_module, resolve_none},
 2720:     Resolver = fun contact_a_2/3,
 2721: 
 2722:     PartCtrlr = setup_partitions(Config, [Part1, Part2]),
 2723: 
 2724:     erpc:call(
 2725:       PartCtrlr,
 2726:       fun () ->
 2727:               erpc:call(
 2728:                 A2,
 2729:                 fun () ->
 2730:                         lists:foreach(
 2731:                           fun({TheName, TheResolver}) ->
 2732:                                   {Pid2, yes} = start_resolver(TheName, TheResolver),
 2733:                                   trace_message({node(), part_2_2, nodes(), {pid2,Pid2}})
 2734:                           end, [{Name, NoResolver}, {ResName, Resolver}])
 2735:                 end)
 2736:       end),
 2737: 
 2738:     %% resolved_name is resolved to run on a_2, an insert operation is
 2739:     %% sent to n_1. The resolver function halts a_2, but the nodedown
 2740:     %% message is handled by n_1 _before_ the insert operation is run
 2741:     %% (at least every now and then; sometimes it seems to be
 2742:     %% delayed). Unless "artificial" nodedown messages are sent the
 2743:     %% name would linger on indefinitely. [There is no test case for
 2744:     %% the situation that no nodedown message at all is sent.]
 2745:     {_Pid1, yes} =
 2746:         rpc:call(N1, ?MODULE, start_resolver, 
 2747:                  [ResName, fun contact_a_2/3]),
 2748:     ct:sleep(1000),
 2749: 
 2750:     trace_message({node(), pinging, z_2}),
 2751:     pong = net_adm:ping(Z2),
 2752:     ?UNTIL((Nodes -- [A2]) =:= lists:sort(?NODES)),
 2753:     ct:sleep(1000),
 2754: 
 2755:     {_,Trace0} = collect_tracers(Nodes),
 2756: 
 2757:     Resolvers = [P || {_Node,new_resolver,{pid,P}} <- Trace0],
 2758:     lists:foreach(fun(P) -> P ! die end, Resolvers),
 2759:     lists:foreach(fun(P) -> wait_for_exit(P) end, Resolvers),
 2760: 
 2761:     lists:foreach(fun(N) ->
 2762: 			  rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, stop_tracer, [])
 2763: 		  end, Nodes),
 2764: 
 2765:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 2766:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 2767:     stop_nodes(Cps),
 2768:     stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr),
 2769:     init_condition(Config),
 2770:     ok.
 2771: 
 2772: %% Runs on n_1
 2773: contact_a_2(resolved_name, Pid1, Pid2) ->
 2774:     trace_message({node(), ?REGNAME, {pid1,Pid1}, {pid2,Pid2}, 
 2775: 		   {node1,node(Pid1)}, {node2,node(Pid2)}}),
 2776:     ?REGNAME ! doit,
 2777:     Pid2.
 2778: 
 2779: ping_a_2_fun(RegName, N1, A2) ->
 2780:     spawn(N1, fun() -> ping_a_2(RegName, N1, A2) end).
 2781: 
 2782: ping_a_2(RegName, N1, A2) ->
 2783:     register(RegName, self()),
 2784:     receive doit -> 
 2785:             trace_message({node(), ping_a_2, {a2, A2}}),
 2786:             monitor_node(A2, true),
 2787:             %% Establish contact with a_2, then take it down.
 2788:             rpc:call(N1, ?MODULE, halt_node, [A2]),
 2789:             receive
 2790:                 {nodedown, A2} -> ok
 2791:             end
 2792:     end.
 2793: 
 2794: halt_node(Node) ->
 2795:     rpc:call(Node, erlang, halt, []).
 2796: 
 2797: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 2798: %%% Testing re-registration of a name.
 2799: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 2800: %% OTP-5563. Name is re-registered.
 2801: re_register_name(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2802:     %% When re-registering a name the link to the old pid used to
 2803:     %% linger on. Don't think is was a serious bug though--some memory
 2804:     %% occupied by links, that's all.
 2805:     %% Later: now monitors are checked.
 2806:     Timeout = 15,
 2807:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 2808:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 2809:     init_condition(Config),
 2810:     Me = self(),
 2811:     Pid1 = spawn(fun() -> proc(Me) end),
 2812:     yes = global:register_name(name, Pid1),
 2813:     wait_for_monitor(Pid1),
 2814:     Pid2 = spawn(fun() -> proc(Me) end),
 2815:     _ = global:re_register_name(name, Pid2),
 2816:     wait_for_monitor(Pid2),
 2817:     Pid2 ! die,
 2818:     Pid1 ! die,
 2819:     receive {Pid1, MonitoredBy1} -> [] = MonitoredBy1 end,
 2820:     receive {Pid2, MonitoredBy2} -> [_] = MonitoredBy2 end,
 2821:     _ = global:unregister_name(name),
 2822:     init_condition(Config),
 2823:     ok.
 2824: 
 2825: wait_for_monitor(Pid) ->
 2826:     case process_info(Pid, monitored_by) of
 2827:         {monitored_by, []} ->
 2828:             timer:sleep(1),
 2829:             wait_for_monitor(Pid);
 2830:         {monitored_by, [_]} ->
 2831:             ok
 2832:     end.
 2833: 
 2834: proc(Parent) ->
 2835:     receive die -> ok end,
 2836:     {monitored_by, MonitoredBy} = process_info(self(), monitored_by),
 2837:     Parent ! {self(), MonitoredBy}.
 2838: 
 2839: 
 2840: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 2841: %%% 
 2842: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 2843: %% OTP-5563. Registered process dies.
 2844: name_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2845:     StartFun = fun() ->
 2846:                        {ok, N1} = start_node_rel(n_1, this, Config),
 2847:                        {ok, N2} = start_node_rel(n_2, this, Config),
 2848:                        [N1, N2]
 2849:                end,
 2850:     io:format("Test of current release~n"),
 2851:     do_name_exit(StartFun, current, Config).
 2852: 
 2853: do_name_exit(StartFun, Version, Config) ->
 2854:     %% When a registered process dies, the node where it is registered
 2855:     %% removes the name from the table immediately, and then removes
 2856:     %% it from other nodes using a lock.
 2857:     %% This is perhaps not how it should work, but it is not easy to
 2858:     %% change.
 2859:     %% See also OTP-3737.
 2860:     %%
 2861:     %% The current release uses monitors so this test is not so relevant.
 2862: 
 2863:     Timeout = 60,
 2864:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 2865:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 2866:     init_condition(Config),
 2867:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 2868: 
 2869:     %% Three nodes (test_server, n_1, n_2). 
 2870:     Cps = StartFun(),
 2871:     Nodes = lists:sort([node() | Cps]),
 2872:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 2873:     lists:foreach(fun(N) -> rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, start_tracer, []) end,Nodes),
 2874: 
 2875:     Name = name,
 2876:     {Pid, yes} = start_proc(Name),
 2877: 
 2878:     Me = self(),
 2879:     LL = spawn(fun() -> long_lock(Me) end),
 2880:     receive 
 2881:         long_lock_taken -> ok
 2882:     end,
 2883: 
 2884:     Pid ! die,                    
 2885:     wait_for_exit_fast(Pid),
 2886: 
 2887:     ct:sleep(100),
 2888:     %% Name has been removed from node()'s table, but nowhere else
 2889:     %% since there is a lock on 'global'.
 2890:     {R1,[]} = rpc:multicall(Nodes, global, whereis_name, [Name]),
 2891:     case Version of
 2892: 	old -> [_,_] = lists:usort(R1);
 2893: 	current -> [undefined, undefined, undefined] = R1
 2894:     end,
 2895:     ct:sleep(3000),
 2896:     check_everywhere(Nodes, Name, Config),
 2897: 
 2898:     lists:foreach(fun(N) -> rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, stop_tracer, []) end, Nodes),
 2899:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 2900:     exit(LL, kill),
 2901:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 2902:     stop_nodes(Cps),
 2903:     init_condition(Config),
 2904:     ok.
 2905: 
 2906: long_lock(Parent) ->
 2907:     global:trans({?GLOBAL_LOCK,self()}, 
 2908:                  fun() -> 
 2909:                          Parent ! long_lock_taken,
 2910:                          timer:sleep(3000) 
 2911:                  end).
 2912: 
 2913: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 2914: %%% Testing the support for external nodes (cnodes)
 2915: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 2916: %% OTP-5563. External nodes (cnodes).
 2917: external_nodes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2918:     Timeout = 30,
 2919:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 2920:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 2921:     init_condition(Config),
 2922:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 2923: 
 2924:     [NodeB, NodeC] = start_nodes([b, c], peer, Config),
 2925:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 2926: 
 2927:     %% Nodes = ?NODES,
 2928:     %% lists:foreach(fun(N) -> rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, start_tracer, []) end,
 2929:     %%               Nodes),
 2930:     Name = name,
 2931: 
 2932:     %% Two partitions: [test_server] and [b, c].
 2933:     %% c registers an external name on b
 2934: 
 2935:     PartCtrlr = setup_partitions(Config, [[node()], [NodeB, NodeC]]),
 2936: 
 2937:     erpc:call(
 2938:       PartCtrlr,
 2939:       fun () ->
 2940:               erpc:call(
 2941:                 NodeB,
 2942:                 fun () ->
 2943:                         Pid = spawn(NodeC, fun() -> cnode_proc(NodeB) end),
 2944:                         Pid ! {register, self(), Name},
 2945:                         receive {Pid, Reply} -> yes = Reply end,
 2946:                         erpc:call(NodeC, erlang, register, [Name, Pid])
 2947:                 end)
 2948:       end),
 2949: 
 2950:     pong = net_adm:ping(NodeB),
 2951:     ?UNTIL([NodeB, NodeC] =:= lists:sort(nodes())),
 2952:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 2953: 
 2954:     Cpid = rpc:call(NodeC, erlang, whereis, [Name]),
 2955:     ExternalName = [{name,Cpid,NodeB}],
 2956:     ExternalName = get_ext_names(),
 2957:     ExternalName = rpc:call(NodeB, gen_server, call,
 2958: 			    [global_name_server, get_names_ext]),
 2959:     ExternalName = rpc:call(NodeC, gen_server, call,
 2960: 			    [global_name_server, get_names_ext]),
 2961: 
 2962:     [_] = cnode_links(Cpid),
 2963:     [_,_,_] = cnode_monitored_by(Cpid),
 2964:     no = global:register_name(Name, self()),
 2965:     yes = global:re_register_name(Name, self()),
 2966:     ?UNTIL([] =:= cnode_monitored_by(Cpid)),
 2967:     ?UNTIL([] =:= cnode_links(Cpid)),
 2968:     [] = gen_server:call(global_name_server, get_names_ext, infinity),
 2969: 
 2970:     Cpid ! {register, self(), Name},
 2971:     receive {Cpid, Reply1} -> no = Reply1 end,
 2972:     _ = global:unregister_name(Name),
 2973:     ct:sleep(1000),
 2974:     Cpid ! {register, self(), Name},
 2975:     ?UNTIL(length(get_ext_names()) =:= 1),
 2976:     receive {Cpid, Reply2} -> yes = Reply2 end,
 2977: 
 2978:     Cpid ! {unregister, self(), Name},
 2979:     ?UNTIL(length(get_ext_names()) =:= 0),
 2980:     receive {Cpid, Reply3} -> ok = Reply3 end,
 2981: 
 2982:     Cpid ! die,
 2983:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 2984:     [] = get_ext_names(),
 2985:     [] = rpc:call(NodeB, gen_server, call,
 2986: 		  [global_name_server, get_names_ext]),
 2987:     [] = rpc:call(NodeC, gen_server, call,
 2988: 		  [global_name_server, get_names_ext]),
 2989: 
 2990:     Cpid2 = erlang:spawn(NodeC, fun() -> cnode_proc(NodeB) end),
 2991:     Cpid2 ! {register, self(), Name},
 2992:     receive {Cpid2, Reply4} -> yes = Reply4 end,
 2993: 
 2994:     %% It could be a bug that Cpid2 is linked to 'global_name_server'
 2995:     %% at node 'b'. The effect: Cpid2 dies when node 'b' crashes.
 2996:     stop_node(NodeB),
 2997:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 2998:     [] = get_ext_names(),
 2999:     [] = rpc:call(NodeC, gen_server, call,
 3000: 		  [global_name_server, get_names_ext]),
 3001: 
 3002:     %% {_, Trace} = collect_tracers(Nodes),
 3003:     %% lists:foreach(fun(M) -> erlang:display(M) end, Trace),
 3004: 
 3005:     ThisNode = node(),
 3006:     Cpid3 = erlang:spawn(NodeC, fun() -> cnode_proc(ThisNode) end),
 3007:     Cpid3 ! {register, self(), Name},
 3008:     receive {Cpid3, Reply5} -> yes = Reply5 end,
 3009: 
 3010:     ?UNTIL(length(get_ext_names()) =:= 1),
 3011:     stop_node(NodeC),
 3012:     stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr),
 3013:     ?UNTIL(length(get_ext_names()) =:= 0),
 3014: 
 3015:     init_condition(Config),
 3016:     ok.
 3017: 
 3018: get_ext_names() ->
 3019:     gen_server:call(global_name_server, get_names_ext, infinity).
 3020: 
 3021: cnode_links(Pid) ->
 3022:     Pid ! {links, self()},
 3023:     receive 
 3024:         {links, Links} ->
 3025:             Links
 3026:     end.
 3027: 
 3028: cnode_monitored_by(Pid) ->
 3029:     Pid ! {monitored_by, self()},
 3030:     receive 
 3031:         {monitored_by, MonitoredBy} ->
 3032:             MonitoredBy
 3033:     end.
 3034: 
 3035: cnode_proc(E) ->
 3036:     receive
 3037:         {register, From, Name} ->
 3038:             Rep = rpc:call(E, global, register_name_external, [Name, self()]),
 3039:             From ! {self(), Rep};
 3040:         {unregister, From, Name} ->
 3041:             _ = rpc:call(E, global, unregister_name_external, [Name]),
 3042:             From ! {self(), ok};
 3043:         {links, From} ->
 3044:             From ! process_info(self(), links);
 3045:         {monitored_by, From} ->
 3046:             From ! process_info(self(), monitored_by);
 3047:         die ->
 3048:             exit(normal)
 3049:     end,
 3050:     cnode_proc(E).
 3051: 
 3052: 
 3053: %% OTP-5770. Start many nodes. Make them connect at the same time.
 3054: many_nodes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3055:     Timeout = 240,
 3056:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 3057:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 3058:     init_condition(Config),
 3059:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 3060: 
 3061:     {Rels, N_cps} = 
 3062:         case os:type() of
 3063:             {unix, Osname} when Osname =:= linux; 
 3064:                                 Osname =:= openbsd; 
 3065:                                 Osname =:= darwin ->
 3066:                 N_nodes = quite_a_few_nodes(32),
 3067:                 {node_rel(1, N_nodes), N_nodes};
 3068:             {unix, _} ->
 3069:                 {node_rel(1, 32), 32};
 3070:             _ -> 
 3071:                 {node_rel(1, 32), 32}
 3072:         end,
 3073:     Cps = [begin {ok, Cp} = start_node_rel(Name, Rel, Config), Cp end ||
 3074: 	      {Name,Rel} <- Rels],
 3075:     Nodes = lists:sort(?NODES),
 3076:     wait_for_ready_net(Nodes, Config),
 3077: 
 3078:     %% All nodes isolated not connected to any other (visible) nodes...
 3079:     Partitions = [[node()] | lists:map(fun (Node) -> [Node] end, Cps)],
 3080: 
 3081:     PartCtrlr = setup_partitions(Config, Partitions),
 3082: 
 3083:     Time = msec(),
 3084: 
 3085:     erpc:call(
 3086:       PartCtrlr,
 3087:       fun () ->
 3088:               OkRes = lists:map(fun (_) -> {ok, ok} end, Cps),
 3089:               OkRes = erpc:multicall(
 3090:                         Cps,
 3091:                         fun () ->
 3092:                                 lists:foreach(fun(N) ->
 3093:                                                       _ = net_adm:ping(N)
 3094:                                               end, shuffle(Cps)),
 3095:                                 ?UNTIL((Cps -- get_known(node())) =:= []),
 3096:                                 ok
 3097:                         end),
 3098:               ok
 3099:       end),
 3100: 
 3101:     Time2 = msec(),
 3102: 
 3103:     lists:foreach(fun(N) -> pong = net_adm:ping(N) end, Cps),
 3104: 
 3105:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 3106: 
 3107:     write_high_level_trace(Config), % The test succeeded, but was it slow?
 3108: 
 3109:     ?UNTIL(OrigNames =:= global:registered_names()),
 3110:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 3111:     stop_nodes(Cps),
 3112:     stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr),
 3113:     init_condition(Config),
 3114:     Diff = Time2 - Time,
 3115:     Return = lists:flatten(io_lib:format("~w nodes took ~w ms", 
 3116:                                          [N_cps, Diff])),
 3117:     erlang:display({{nodes,N_cps},{time,Diff}}),
 3118:     io:format("~s~n", [Return]),
 3119:     {comment, Return}.
 3120: 
 3121: node_rel(From, To) ->
 3122:     NodeNumbers = lists:seq(From, To),
 3123:     Release = erlang:system_info(otp_release),
 3124:     LastRelease = integer_to_list(list_to_integer(Release) - 1) ++ "_latest",
 3125:     Last = case test_server:is_release_available(LastRelease) of
 3126:                true -> list_to_atom(LastRelease);
 3127:                false -> this
 3128:            end,
 3129:     [{lists:concat([cp, N]),
 3130:       case N rem 2 of
 3131:           0 -> this;
 3132:           1 -> Last
 3133:       end} || N <- NodeNumbers].
 3134: 
 3135: touch(File, List) ->
 3136:     ok = file:write_file(File, list_to_binary(List)).
 3137: 
 3138: append_to_file(File, Term) ->
 3139:     {ok, Fd} = file:open(File, [raw,binary,append]),
 3140:     ok = file:write(Fd, io_lib:format("~p.~n", [Term])),
 3141:     ok = file:close(Fd).
 3142: 
 3143: file_contents(File, ContentsList, Config) ->
 3144:     file_contents(File, ContentsList, Config, no_log_file).
 3145: 
 3146: file_contents(File, ContentsList, Config, LogFile) ->
 3147:     Contents = list_to_binary(ContentsList),    
 3148:     Sz = size(Contents),
 3149:     ?UNTIL(begin
 3150:                case file:read_file(File) of
 3151:                    {ok, FileContents}=Reply -> 
 3152:                        case catch split_binary(FileContents, Sz) of
 3153:                            {Contents,_} ->
 3154:                                true;
 3155:                            _ ->
 3156:                                catch append_to_file(LogFile,
 3157:                                                     {File,Contents,Reply}),
 3158:                                false
 3159:                        end;
 3160:                    Reply ->
 3161:                        catch append_to_file(LogFile, {File, Contents, Reply}),
 3162:                        false
 3163:                end
 3164:            end).
 3165: 
 3166: shuffle(L) ->
 3167:     [E || {_, E} <- lists:keysort(1, [{rand:uniform(), E} || E <- L])].
 3168: 
 3169: %% OTP-5770. sync/0.
 3170: sync_0(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3171:     Timeout = 180,
 3172:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 3173:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 3174:     init_condition(Config),
 3175: 
 3176:     N_cps = 
 3177:         case os:type() of
 3178:             {unix, Osname} when Osname =:= linux; 
 3179:                                 Osname =:= openbsd; 
 3180:                                 Osname =:= darwin ->
 3181:                 quite_a_few_nodes(30);
 3182:             {unix, sunos} ->
 3183:                 30;
 3184:             {unix, _} ->
 3185:                 16;
 3186:             _ -> 
 3187:                 30
 3188:         end,
 3189: 
 3190:     Names = [lists:concat([cp,N]) || N <- lists:seq(1, N_cps)],
 3191:     Cps = start_and_sync(Names),
 3192:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 3193:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 3194:     stop_nodes(Cps),
 3195: 
 3196:     init_condition(Config),
 3197:     ok.
 3198: 
 3199: start_and_sync([]) ->
 3200:     [];
 3201: start_and_sync([Name | Names]) ->
 3202:     {ok, N} = start_node(Name, slave, []),
 3203:     {Time, _Void} = rpc:call(N, timer, tc, [global, sync, []]),
 3204:     io:format("~p: ~p~n", [Name, Time]),
 3205:     [N | start_and_sync(Names)].
 3206: 
 3207: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 3208: %%% Testing of change of global_groups parameter.
 3209: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 3210: %% Test change of global_groups parameter.
 3211: global_groups_change(Config) ->
 3212:     Timeout = 90,
 3213:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 3214:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 3215:     init_condition(Config),
 3216:     M = from($@, atom_to_list(node())),
 3217: 
 3218:     %% Create the .app files and the boot script
 3219:     {KernelVer, StdlibVer} = create_script_dc("dc"),
 3220:     case is_real_system(KernelVer, StdlibVer) of
 3221: 	true ->
 3222: 	    Options = [];
 3223: 	false  ->
 3224: 	    Options = [local]
 3225:     end,
 3226: 
 3227:     ok = systools:make_script("dc", Options),
 3228: 
 3229:     [Ncp1,Ncp2,Ncp3,Ncp4,Ncp5,NcpA,NcpB,NcpC,NcpD,NcpE] = 
 3230:         node_names([cp1,cp2,cp3,cp4,cp5,cpA,cpB,cpC,cpD,cpE], Config),
 3231: 
 3232:     %% Write config files
 3233:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 3234:     {ok, Fd_dc} = file:open(filename:join(Dir, "sys.config"), [write]),
 3235:     config_dc1(Fd_dc, Ncp1, Ncp2, Ncp3, NcpA, NcpB, NcpC, NcpD, NcpE),
 3236:     file:close(Fd_dc),
 3237:     Config1 = filename:join(Dir, "sys"),
 3238: 
 3239:     %% Test [cp1, cp2, cp3]
 3240:     {ok, Cp1} = start_node_boot(Ncp1, Config1, dc),
 3241:     {ok, Cp2} = start_node_boot(Ncp2, Config1, dc),
 3242:     {ok, Cp3} = start_node_boot(Ncp3, Config1, dc),
 3243:     {ok, CpA} = start_node_boot(NcpA, Config1, dc),
 3244:     {ok, CpB} = start_node_boot(NcpB, Config1, dc),
 3245:     {ok, CpC} = start_node_boot(NcpC, Config1, dc),
 3246:     {ok, CpD} = start_node_boot(NcpD, Config1, dc),
 3247:     {ok, CpE} = start_node_boot(NcpE, Config1, dc),
 3248: 
 3249:     pong = rpc:call(Cp1, net_adm, ping, [Cp2]),
 3250:     pong = rpc:call(Cp1, net_adm, ping, [Cp3]),
 3251:     pang = rpc:call(Cp1, net_adm, ping,
 3252: 		    [list_to_atom(lists:concat(["cp5@", M]))]),
 3253:     pong = rpc:call(Cp2, net_adm, ping, [Cp3]),
 3254:     pang = rpc:call(Cp2, net_adm, ping,
 3255: 		    [list_to_atom(lists:concat(["cp5@", M]))]),
 3256: 
 3257:     {TestGG4, yes} = rpc:call(CpB, ?MODULE, start_proc, [test]),
 3258:     {TestGG5, yes} = rpc:call(CpE, ?MODULE, start_proc, [test]),
 3259: 
 3260: 
 3261:     pong = rpc:call(CpA, net_adm, ping, [CpC]),
 3262:     pong = rpc:call(CpC, net_adm, ping, [CpB]),
 3263:     pong = rpc:call(CpD, net_adm, ping, [CpC]),
 3264:     pong = rpc:call(CpE, net_adm, ping, [CpD]),
 3265: 
 3266:     ?UNTIL(begin
 3267:                TestGG4_1 = rpc:call(CpA, global, whereis_name, [test]),
 3268:                TestGG4_2 = rpc:call(CpB, global, whereis_name, [test]),
 3269:                TestGG4_3 = rpc:call(CpC, global, whereis_name, [test]),
 3270: 
 3271:                TestGG5_1 = rpc:call(CpD, global, whereis_name, [test]),
 3272:                TestGG5_2 = rpc:call(CpE, global, whereis_name, [test]),
 3273:                io:format("~p~n", [[TestGG4, TestGG4_1, TestGG4_2,TestGG4_3]]),
 3274:                io:format("~p~n", [[TestGG5, TestGG5_1, TestGG5_2]]),
 3275:                (TestGG4_1 =:= TestGG4) and
 3276:                (TestGG4_2 =:= TestGG4) and
 3277:                (TestGG4_3 =:= TestGG4) and
 3278:                (TestGG5_1 =:= TestGG5) and
 3279:                (TestGG5_2 =:= TestGG5)
 3280:            end),
 3281: 
 3282:     io:format( "#### nodes() ~p~n",[nodes()]),
 3283: 
 3284:     XDcWa1 = rpc:call(Cp1, global_group, info, []),
 3285:     XDcWa2 = rpc:call(Cp2, global_group, info, []),
 3286:     XDcWa3 = rpc:call(Cp3, global_group, info, []),
 3287:     io:format( "#### XDcWa1 ~p~n",[XDcWa1]),

 3335: 		  application_controller, config_change, [OldEnv]),

 3577:     stop_node(CpD),

 3579:

 3582: 
 3583: gg_sync_and_wait(Node, Synced, SyncError, NoContact) ->
 3584:     ok = rpc:call(Node, global_group, sync, []),
 3585:     gg_wait(Node, Synced, SyncError, NoContact).
 3586: 
 3587: gg_wait(Node, Synced, SyncError, NoContact) ->
 3588:     receive after 100 -> ok end,
 3589:     try
 3590:         GGInfo = rpc:call(Node, global_group, info, []),
 3591:         ct:pal("GG info: ~p~n", [GGInfo]),
 3592:         case proplists:lookup(synced_nodes, GGInfo) of
 3593:             {synced_nodes, Synced} -> ok;
 3594:             _ -> throw(wait)
 3595:         end,
 3596:         case proplists:lookup(sync_error, GGInfo) of
 3597:             {sync_error, SyncError} -> ok;
 3598:             _ -> throw(wait)
 3599:         end,
 3600:         case proplists:lookup(no_contact, GGInfo) of
 3601:             {no_contact, NoContact} -> ok;
 3602:             _ -> throw(wait)
 3603:         end
 3604:     catch
 3605:         throw:wait ->
 3606:             gg_wait(Node, Synced, SyncError, NoContact)
 3607:     end.
 3608: 
 3609: %%% Copied from init_SUITE.erl.
 3610: is_real_system(KernelVsn, StdlibVsn) ->
 3611:     LibDir = code:lib_dir(),
 3612:     filelib:is_dir(filename:join(LibDir,  "kernel-" ++ KernelVsn))
 3613: 	andalso
 3614: 	filelib:is_dir(filename:join(LibDir,  "stdlib-" ++ StdlibVsn)).
 3615: 
 3616: create_script_dc(ScriptName) ->
 3617:     Name = filename:join(".", ScriptName),
 3618:     Apps = application_controller:which_applications(),
 3619:     {value,{_,_,KernelVer}} = lists:keysearch(kernel,1,Apps),
 3620:     {value,{_,_,StdlibVer}} = lists:keysearch(stdlib,1,Apps),
 3621:     {ok,Fd} = file:open(Name ++ ".rel", [write]),
 3622:     {_, Version} = init:script_id(),
 3623:     io:format(Fd,
 3624: 	      "{release, {\"Test release 3\", \"~s\"}, \n"
 3625: 	      " {erts, \"4.4\"}, \n"
 3626: 	      " [{kernel, \"~s\"}, {stdlib, \"~s\"}]}.\n",
 3627: 	      [Version, KernelVer, StdlibVer]),
 3628:     file:close(Fd),
 3629:     {KernelVer, StdlibVer}.
 3630:

 3637: 	      "               {gg2, ['~s@~s']}]}"
 3638: 	      "              ]}].~n",
 3639: 	      [Ncp1, M, Ncp2, M, Ncp3, M,  Ncp1, M, Ncp2, M, Ncp3, M]).
 3640:

 3646: 	      "{global_groups, [{gg1, ['~s@~s', '~s@~s']},"

 3649: 	      "                 {gg5, hidden, ['~s@~s','~s@~s']}]}]}].~n",
 3650: 	      [Ncp1, M, Ncp2, M, Ncp3, M,  
 3651:                NcpA, M, NcpB, M, NcpC, M, NcpD, M, NcpE, M,

 3661: 	      "~p]}].~n",
