 3674: w(X,Y) ->
 3675:     {ok, F} = file:open("cp2.log", [write]),
 3676:     io:format(F, X, Y),
 3677:     file:close(F).
 3678: 
 3679: start_procs(Parent, N1, N2, N3, Config) ->
 3680:     S1 = lists:sort([N1, N2, N3]),
 3681:     ?UNTIL(begin
 3682: 	       NN = lists:sort(nodes()),
 3683: 	       S1 =:= NN
 3684: 	   end),
 3685:     Pid3 = start_proc3(test1),
 3686:     Pid4 = rpc:call(N1, ?MODULE, start_proc3, [test2]),
 3687:     assert_pid(Pid4),
 3688:     Pid5 = rpc:call(N2, ?MODULE, start_proc3, [test3]),
 3689:     assert_pid(Pid5),
 3690:     Pid6 = rpc:call(N3, ?MODULE, start_proc3, [test4]),
 3691:     assert_pid(Pid6),
 3692:     yes = global:register_name(test1, Pid3),
 3693:     yes = global:register_name(test2, Pid4, fun global:notify_all_name/3),
 3694:     yes = global:register_name(test3, Pid5, fun global:random_notify_name/3),
 3695:     Resolve = fun(Name, Pid1, Pid2) ->
 3696: 		      Parent ! {resolve_called, Name, node()},
 3697: 		      {Min, Max} = minmax(Pid1, Pid2),
 3698: 		      exit(Min, kill),
 3699: 		      Max
 3700: 	      end,
 3701:     yes = global:register_name(test4, Pid6, Resolve).
 3702: 
 3703: 
 3704: 
 3705: collect_resolves() -> cr(0).
 3706: cr(Res) ->
 3707:     receive
 3708: 	{resolve_called, Name, Node} ->
 3709: 	    ?P("resolve called: ~w ~w", [Name, Node]),
 3710:  	    cr(Res+1)
 3711:     after
 3712: 	0 -> Res
 3713:     end.
 3714: 
 3715: minmax(P1,P2) ->
 3716:     if node(P1) < node(P2) -> {P1, P2}; true -> {P2, P1} end.
 3717: 
 3718: fix_basic_name(name03, Pid1, Pid2) ->
 3719:     case atom_to_list(node(Pid1)) of
 3720: 	[$c, $p, $3|_] -> exit(Pid2, kill), Pid1;
 3721: 	_ -> exit(Pid1, kill), Pid2
 3722:     end;
 3723: fix_basic_name(name12, Pid1, Pid2) ->
 3724:     case atom_to_list(node(Pid1)) of
 3725: 	[$c, $p, $2|_] -> exit(Pid2, kill), Pid1;
 3726: 	_ -> exit(Pid1, kill), Pid2
 3727:     end.
 3728: 
 3729: start_proc() ->
 3730:     Pid = spawn(?MODULE, p_init, [self()]),
 3731:     receive
 3732: 	Pid -> Pid
 3733:     end.
 3734: 
 3735: 
 3736: start_proc(Name) ->
 3737:     Pid = spawn(?MODULE, p_init, [self(), Name]),
 3738:     receive
 3739: 	{Pid, Res} -> {Pid, Res}
 3740:     end.
 3741: 
 3742: start_proc2(Name) ->
 3743:     Pid = spawn(?MODULE, p_init2, [self(), Name]),
 3744:     receive
 3745: 	Pid -> Pid
 3746:     end.
 3747: 
 3748: start_proc3(Name) ->
 3749:     Pid = spawn(?MODULE, p_init, [self()]),
 3750:     register(Name, Pid),
 3751:     receive
 3752: 	Pid -> Pid
 3753:     end.
 3754: 
 3755: start_proc4(Name) ->
 3756:     Pid = spawn(?MODULE, p_init, [self()]),
 3757:     yes = global:register_name(Name, Pid),
 3758:     receive
 3759: 	Pid -> Pid
 3760:     end.
 3761: 
 3762: start_proc_basic(Name) ->
 3763:     Pid = spawn(?MODULE, init_proc_basic, [self(), Name]),
 3764:     receive
 3765: 	{Pid, Res} -> {Pid, Res}
 3766:     end.
 3767: 
 3768: init_proc_basic(Parent, Name) ->
 3769:     X = global:register_name(Name, self(), fun ?MODULE:fix_basic_name/3),
 3770:     Parent ! {self(),X},
 3771:     loop().
 3772: 
 3773: single_node(Time, Node) ->
 3774:     spawn(?MODULE, init_2, []),
 3775:     timer:sleep(Time - msec()),
 3776:     _ = net_adm:ping(Node),
 3777:     ok.
 3778: 
 3779: init_2() ->
 3780:     register(single_name, self()),
 3781:     yes = global:register_name(single_name, self()),
 3782:     loop_2().
 3783: 
 3784: loop_2() ->
 3785:     receive
 3786: 	die -> ok
 3787:     end.
 3788: 
 3789: msec() ->
 3790:     msec(erlang:timestamp()).
 3791: 
 3792: msec(T) ->
 3793:     element(1,T)*1000000000 + element(2,T)*1000 + element(3,T) div 1000.
 3794: 
 3795: assert_pid(Pid) ->
 3796:     if
 3797: 	is_pid(Pid) -> true;
 3798: 	true -> exit({not_a_pid, Pid})
 3799:     end.
 3800: 
 3801: check_same([H|T]) -> check_same(T, H).
 3802: 
 3803: check_same([H|T], H) -> check_same(T, H);
 3804: check_same([], _H) -> ok.
 3805: 
 3806: check_same_p([H|T]) -> check_same_p(T, H).
 3807: 
 3808: check_same_p([H|T], H) -> check_same_p(T, H);
 3809: check_same_p([], _H) -> true;
 3810: check_same_p(_, _) -> false.
 3811: 
 3812: p_init(Parent) ->
 3813:     Parent ! self(),
 3814:     loop().
 3815: 
 3816: p_init(Parent, Name) ->
 3817:     X = global:register_name(Name, self()),
 3818:     Parent ! {self(),X},
 3819:     loop().
 3820: 
 3821: p_init2(Parent, Name) ->
 3822:     _ = global:re_register_name(Name, self()),
 3823:     Parent ! self(),
 3824:     loop().
 3825: 
 3826: req(Pid, Msg) ->
 3827:     Pid ! Msg,
 3828:     receive X -> X end.
 3829: 
 3830: sreq(Pid, Msg) ->
 3831:     Ref = make_ref(),
 3832:     Pid ! {Msg, Ref},
 3833:     receive {Ref, X} -> X end.
 3834: 
 3835: alone(N1, N2) ->
 3836:     ct:sleep(12000),
 3837:     net_adm:ping(N1),
 3838:     net_adm:ping(N2),
 3839:     yes = global:register_name(test5, self()).
 3840: 
 3841: crash(Time) ->
 3842:     %% ct:sleep/1 will not work because it calls a server process
 3843:     %% that does not run on other nodes.
 3844:     timer:sleep(Time),
 3845:     erlang:halt().
 3846: 
 3847: loop() ->
 3848:     receive
 3849: 	{ping, From} ->
 3850: 	    From ! {pong, node()},
 3851: 	    loop();
 3852: 	{del_lock, Id} ->
 3853: 	    global:del_lock({Id, self()}),
 3854: 	    loop();
 3855: 	{del_lock_sync, Id, From} ->
 3856: 	    global:del_lock({Id, self()}),
 3857: 	    From ! true,
 3858: 	    loop();
 3859: 	{del_lock, Id, Nodes} ->
 3860: 	    global:del_lock({Id, self()}, Nodes),
 3861: 	    loop();
 3862: 	{del_lock2, Id, From} ->
 3863: 	    global:del_lock(Id),
 3864: 	    From ! true,
 3865: 	    loop();
 3866: 	{del_lock2, Id, From, Nodes} ->
 3867: 	    global:del_lock(Id, Nodes),
 3868: 	    From ! true,
 3869: 	    loop();
 3870: 	{set_lock, Id, From} ->
 3871: 	    Res = global:set_lock({Id, self()}, ?NODES, 1),
 3872: 	    From ! Res,
 3873: 	    loop();
 3874: 	{set_lock, Id, From, Nodes} ->
 3875: 	    Res = global:set_lock({Id, self()}, Nodes, 1),
 3876: 	    From ! Res,
 3877: 	    loop();
 3878: 	{set_lock_loop, Id, From} ->
 3879: 	    true = global:set_lock({Id, self()}, ?NODES),
 3880: 	    From ! {got_lock, self()},
 3881: 	    loop();
 3882: 	{set_lock2, Id, From} ->
 3883: 	    Res = global:set_lock(Id, ?NODES, 1),
 3884: 	    From ! Res,
 3885: 	    loop();
 3886: 	{{got_notify, From}, Ref} ->
 3887: 	    receive
 3888: 		X when element(1, X) =:= global_name_conflict ->
 3889: 		    From ! {Ref, yes}
 3890: 	    after
 3891: 		0 -> From ! {Ref, no}
 3892: 	    end,
 3893: 	    loop();
 3894: 	die ->
 3895: 	    exit(normal);
 3896: 	drop_dead ->
 3897: 	    exit(drop_dead)
 3898:     end.
 3899: 
 3900: -ifdef(unused).
 3901: pr_diff(Str, T0, T1) ->
 3902:     Diff = begin
 3903: 	       {_, {H,M,S}} = calendar:time_difference(T0, T1),
 3904: 	       ((H*60+M)*60)+S
 3905: 	   end,
 3906:     ct:pal(?HI_VERBOSITY,"~13s: ~w (diff: ~w)",[Str, T1, Diff]),
 3907:     if
 3908: 	Diff > 100 ->
 3909: 	    io:format(1,"~s: ** LARGE DIFF ~w~n", [Str, Diff]);
 3910: 	true -> 
 3911: 	    ok
 3912:     end.
 3913: -endif.	    
 3914: 
 3915: now_diff({A1,B1,C1},{A2,B2,C2}) ->
 3916:     C1-C2 + 1000000*((B1-B2) + 1000000*(A1-A2)).
 3917: 
 3918: start_node_boot(Name, Config, Boot) ->
 3919:     Pa = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 3920:     Res = test_server:start_node(Name, peer, [{args, " -pa " ++ Pa ++ 
 3921: 						   " -config " ++ Config ++
 3922: 						   " -boot " ++ atom_to_list(Boot)}]),
 3923:     record_started_node(Res).
 3924: 
 3925: %% Increase the timeout for when an upcoming connection is teared down
 3926: %% again (default is 7 seconds, and can be exceeded by some tests).
 3927: %% The default remains in effect for the test_server node itself, though.
 3928: start_node(Name, Config) ->
 3929:     start_node(Name, slave, Config).
 3930: 
 3931: start_hidden_node(Name, Config) ->
 3932:     start_node(Name, slave, "-hidden", Config).
 3933: 
 3934: start_non_connecting_node(Name, Config) ->
 3935:     start_node(Name, slave, "-connect_all false +W i", Config).
 3936: 
 3937: start_peer_node(Name, Config) ->
 3938:     start_node(Name, peer, Config).
 3939: 
 3940: start_node(Name, How, Config) ->
 3941:     start_node(Name, How, "", Config).
 3942: 
 3943: start_node(Name0, How, Args, Config) ->
 3944:     Name = node_name(Name0, Config),
 3945:     Pa = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 3946:     R = test_server:start_node(
 3947:           Name, How, [{args,
 3948:                        Args ++
 3949:                            " -kernel net_setuptime 100 " ++
 3950:                            %% Limit the amount of threads so that we
 3951:                            %% don't run into the maximum allowed
 3952:                            " +S 1 +SDio 1 " ++
 3953:                            %% "-noshell "
 3954:                            "-pa " ++ Pa},
 3955:                       {linked, false}
 3956:                      ]),
 3957:     %% {linked,false} only seems to work for slave nodes.
 3958:     %%    ct:sleep(1000),
 3959:     record_started_node(R).
 3960: 
 3961: start_node_rel(Name0, Rel, Config) ->
 3962:     Name = node_name(Name0, Config),
 3963:     {Release, Compat} = case Rel of
 3964:                             this ->
 3965:                                 {[this], ""};
 3966:                             Rel when is_atom(Rel) ->
 3967:                                 {[{release, atom_to_list(Rel)}], ""};
 3968:                             RelList ->
 3969: 				{RelList, ""}
 3970: 			end,
 3971:     Env = [],
 3972:     Pa = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 3973:     Res = test_server:start_node(
 3974:             Name, peer,
 3975:             [{args,
 3976:               Compat ++
 3977:                   " -kernel net_setuptime 100 " ++
 3978:                   %% Limit the amount of threads so that we
 3979:                   %% don't run into the maximum allowed
 3980:                   " +S 1 +SDio 1 " ++
 3981:                   "-pa " ++ Pa},
 3982:              {erl, Release}] ++ Env),
 3983:     record_started_node(Res).
 3984: 
 3985: record_started_node({ok, Node}) ->
 3986:     node_started(Node),
 3987:     case erase(?nodes_tag) of
 3988:         undefined -> ok;
 3989:         Nodes -> put(?nodes_tag, [Node | Nodes])
 3990:     end,
 3991:     {ok, Node};
 3992: record_started_node(R) ->
 3993:     R.
 3994: 
 3995: node_names(Names, Config) ->
 3996:     [node_name(Name, Config) || Name <- Names].
 3997: 
 3998: %% simple_resolve assumes that the node name comes first.
 3999: node_name(Name, Config) ->
 4000:     U = "_",
 4001:     {{Y,M,D}, {H,Min,S}} = calendar:now_to_local_time(erlang:timestamp()),
 4002:     Date = io_lib:format("~4w_~2..0w_~2..0w__~2..0w_~2..0w_~2..0w", 
 4003:                          [Y,M,D, H,Min,S]),
 4004:     L = lists:flatten(Date),
 4005:     lists:concat([Name,U,?testcase,U,U,L]).
 4006: 
 4007: stop_nodes(Nodes) ->
 4008:     lists:foreach(fun(Node) -> stop_node(Node) end, Nodes).
 4009: 
 4010: stop_node(Node) ->
 4011:     Res = test_server:stop_node(Node),
 4012:     node_stopped(Node),
 4013:     Res.
 4014: 
 4015: 
 4016: stop() ->
 4017:     lists:foreach(fun(Node) ->
 4018: 			  test_server:stop_node(Node),
 4019:                           node_stopped(Node)
 4020: 		  end, nodes()).
 4021: 
 4022: %% Tests that locally loaded nodes do not loose contact with other nodes.
 4023: global_lost_nodes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 4024:     Timeout = 60,
 4025:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 4026:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 4027:     init_condition(Config),
 4028: 
 4029:     {ok, Node1} = start_node(node1, Config),
 4030:     {ok, Node2} = start_node(node2, Config),
 4031: 
 4032:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 4033: 
 4034:     io:format("Nodes: ~p", [nodes()]),
 4035:     io:format("Nodes at node1: ~p",
 4036: 	      [rpc:call(Node1, erlang, nodes, [])]),
 4037:     io:format("Nodes at node2: ~p",
 4038: 	      [rpc:call(Node2, erlang, nodes, [])]),
 4039: 
 4040:     rpc_cast(Node1, ?MODULE, global_load, [node_1,Node2,node_2]),
 4041:     rpc_cast(Node2, ?MODULE, global_load, [node_2,Node1,node_1]),
 4042: 
 4043:     lost_nodes_waiter(Node1, Node2),
 4044: 
 4045:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 4046:     stop_node(Node1),
 4047:     stop_node(Node2),
 4048:     init_condition(Config),
 4049:     ok.    
 4050: 
 4051: global_load(MyName, OtherNode, OtherName) ->
 4052:     yes = global:register_name(MyName, self()),
 4053:     io:format("Registered ~p",[MyName]),
 4054:     global_load1(OtherNode, OtherName, 0).
 4055: 
 4056: global_load1(_OtherNode, _OtherName, 2) ->
 4057:     io:format("*** ~p giving up. No use.", [node()]),
 4058:     init:stop();
 4059: global_load1(OtherNode, OtherName, Fails) ->	
 4060:     ct:sleep(1000),
 4061:     case catch global:whereis_name(OtherName) of
 4062: 	Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
 4063: 	    io:format("~p says: ~p is still there.",
 4064: 		      [node(),OtherName]),
 4065: 	    global_load1(OtherNode, OtherName, Fails);
 4066: 	Other ->
 4067: 	    io:format("~p says: ~p is lost (~p) Pinging.",
 4068: 		      [ node(), OtherName, Other]),
 4069: 	    case net_adm:ping(OtherNode) of
 4070: 		pong ->
 4071: 		    io:format("Re-established contact to ~p",
 4072: 			      [OtherName]);
 4073: 		pang ->
 4074: 		    io:format("PANIC! Other node is DEAD.", []),
 4075: 		    init:stop()
 4076: 	    end,
 4077: 	    global_load1(OtherNode, OtherName, Fails+1)
 4078:     end.
 4079: 
 4080: lost_nodes_waiter(N1, N2) ->
 4081:     net_kernel:monitor_nodes(true),
 4082:     receive
 4083: 	{nodedown, Node} when Node =:= N1 ; Node =:= N2 ->
 4084: 	    io:format("~p went down!",[Node]),
 4085: 	    ct:fail("Node went down.")
 4086:     after 10000 ->
 4087: 	    ok
 4088:     end,
 4089:     ok.
 4090: 
 4091: 
 4092: 
 4093: %% Tests the simultaneous death of many processes with registered names.
 4094: mass_death(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 4095:     Timeout = 90,
 4096:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 4097:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 4098:     init_condition(Config),
 4099:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 4100:     %% Start nodes
 4101:     Cps = [cp1,cp2,cp3,cp4,cp5],
 4102:     Nodes = [begin {ok, Node} = start_node(Cp, Config), Node end ||
 4103: 		Cp <- Cps],
 4104:     io:format("Nodes: ~p~n", [Nodes]),
 4105:     Ns = lists:seq(1, 40),
 4106:     %% Start processes with globally registered names on the nodes
 4107:     {Pids,[]} = rpc:multicall(Nodes, ?MODULE, init_mass_spawn, [Ns]),
 4108:     io:format("Pids: ~p~n", [Pids]),
 4109:     %% Wait...
 4110:     ct:sleep(10000),
 4111:     %% Check the globally registered names
 4112:     NewNames = global:registered_names(),
 4113:     io:format("NewNames: ~p~n", [NewNames]),
 4114:     Ndiff = lists:sort(NewNames--OrigNames),
 4115:     io:format("Ndiff: ~p~n", [Ndiff]),
 4116:     Ndiff = lists:sort(mass_names(Nodes, Ns)),
 4117:     %%
 4118:     %% Kill the root pids
 4119:     lists:foreach(fun (Pid) -> Pid ! drop_dead end, Pids),
 4120:     %% Start probing and wait for all registered names to disappear
 4121:     {YYYY,MM,DD} = date(),
 4122:     {H,M,S} = time(),
 4123:     io:format("Started probing: ~.4.0w-~.2.0w-~.2.0w ~.2.0w:~.2.0w:~.2.0w~n",
 4124: 	      [YYYY,MM,DD,H,M,S]),
 4125:     wait_mass_death(Nodes, OrigNames, erlang:timestamp(), Config).
 4126: 
 4127: wait_mass_death(Nodes, OrigNames, Then, Config) ->
 4128:     Names = global:registered_names(),
 4129:     case Names--OrigNames of
 4130: 	[] ->
 4131: 	    T = now_diff(erlang:timestamp(), Then) div 1000,
 4132: 	    lists:foreach(
 4133: 	      fun (Node) ->
 4134: 		      stop_node(Node)
 4135: 	      end, Nodes),
 4136: 	    init_condition(Config),
 4137: 	    {comment,lists:flatten(io_lib:format("~.3f s~n", [T/1000.0]))};
 4138: 	Ndiff ->
 4139: 	    io:format("Ndiff: ~p~n", [Ndiff]),
 4140: 	    ct:sleep(1000),
 4141: 	    wait_mass_death(Nodes, OrigNames, Then, Config)
 4142:     end.
 4143: 
 4144: init_mass_spawn(N) ->
 4145:     Pid = mass_spawn(N),
 4146:     unlink(Pid),
 4147:     Pid.
 4148: 
 4149: mass_spawn([]) ->
 4150:     ok;
 4151: mass_spawn([N|T]) ->
 4152:     Parent = self(),
 4153:     Pid = 
 4154: 	spawn_link(
 4155: 	  fun () ->
 4156: 		  Name = mass_name(node(), N),
 4157: 		  yes = global:register_name(Name, self()),
 4158: 		  mass_spawn(T),
 4159: 		  Parent ! self(),
 4160: 		  loop()
 4161: 	  end),
 4162:     receive
 4163:         Pid ->
 4164:             Pid
 4165:     end.
 4166: 
 4167: mass_names([], _) ->
 4168:     [];
 4169: mass_names([Node|T],Ns) ->
 4170:     [mass_name(Node, N) || N <- Ns] ++ mass_names(T, Ns).
 4171: 
 4172: mass_name(Node, N) ->
 4173:     list_to_atom(atom_to_list(Node)++"_"++integer_to_list(N)).
 4174: 
 4175: 
 4176: 
 4177: start_nodes(L, How, Config) ->
 4178:     start_nodes2(L, How, 0, Config),
 4179:     Nodes = collect_nodes(0, length(L)),
 4180:     ?UNTIL([] =:= Nodes -- nodes()),
 4181:     put(?nodes_tag, Nodes),
 4182:     %% Pinging doesn't help, we have to wait too, for nodes() to become
 4183:     %% correct on the other node.
 4184:     lists:foreach(fun(E) ->
 4185: 			  net_adm:ping(E)
 4186: 		  end,
 4187: 		  Nodes),
 4188:     verify_nodes(Nodes, Config),
 4189:     Nodes.
 4190: 
 4191: %% Not used?
 4192: start_nodes_serially([], _, _Config) ->
 4193:     [];
 4194: start_nodes_serially([Name | Rest], How, Config) ->
 4195:     {ok, R} = start_node(Name, How, Config),
 4196:     [R | start_nodes_serially(Rest, How, Config)].
 4197: 
 4198: verify_nodes(Nodes, Config) ->
 4199:     verify_nodes(Nodes, lists:sort([node() | Nodes]), Config).
 4200: 
 4201: verify_nodes([], _N, _Config) ->
 4202:     [];
 4203: verify_nodes([Node | Rest], N, Config) ->
 4204:     ?UNTIL(
 4205:        case rpc:call(Node, erlang, nodes, []) of
 4206: 	   Nodes when is_list(Nodes) ->
 4207: 	       case N =:= lists:sort([Node | Nodes]) of
 4208: 		   true ->
 4209: 		       true;
 4210: 		   false ->
 4211: 		       lists:foreach(fun(Nd) ->
 4212: 					     rpc:call(Nd, net_adm, ping,
 4213:                                                       [Node])
 4214: 				     end,
 4215: 				     nodes()),
 4216: 		       false
 4217: 	       end;
 4218: 	   _ ->
 4219: 	       false
 4220:        end
 4221:       ),
 4222:     verify_nodes(Rest, N, Config).
 4223: 
 4224: 
 4225: start_nodes2([], _How, _, _Config) ->
 4226:     [];
 4227: start_nodes2([Name | Rest], How, N, Config) ->
 4228:     Self = self(),
 4229:     spawn(fun() ->
 4230: 		  erlang:display({starting, Name}),
 4231: 		  {ok, R} = start_node(Name, How, Config),
 4232: 		  erlang:display({started, Name, R}),
 4233: 		  Self ! {N, R},
 4234: 		  %% sleeping is necessary, or with peer nodes, they will
 4235: 		  %% go down again, despite {linked, false}.
 4236: 		  ct:sleep(100000)
 4237: 	  end),
 4238:     start_nodes2(Rest, How, N+1, Config).
 4239: 
 4240: collect_nodes(N, N) ->
 4241:     [];
 4242: collect_nodes(N, Max) ->
 4243:     receive
 4244: 	{N, Node} ->
 4245:             [Node | collect_nodes(N+1, Max)]
 4246:     end.
 4247: 
 4248: exit_p(Pid) ->
 4249:     Ref = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 4250:     Pid ! die,
 4251:     receive
 4252: 	{'DOWN', Ref, process, Pid, _Reason} ->
 4253: 	    ok
 4254:     end.
 4255: 
 4256: wait_for_exit(Pid) ->
 4257:     Ref = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 4258:     receive
 4259: 	{'DOWN', Ref, process, Pid, _Reason} ->
 4260: 	    ok
 4261:     end.
 4262: 
 4263: wait_for_exit_fast(Pid) ->
 4264:     Ref = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 4265:     receive
 4266: 	{'DOWN', Ref, process, Pid, _Reason} ->
 4267: 	    ok
 4268:     end.
 4269: 
 4270: check_everywhere(Nodes, Name, Config) ->
 4271:     ?UNTIL(begin
 4272: 	       case rpc:multicall(Nodes, global, whereis_name, [Name]) of
 4273: 		   {Ns1, []} ->
 4274: 		       check_same_p(Ns1);
 4275: 		   _R ->
 4276: 		       false
 4277: 	       end
 4278: 	   end).
 4279: 
 4280: init_condition(Config) ->
 4281:     io:format("globally registered names: ~p~n", [global:registered_names()]),
 4282:     io:format("nodes: ~p~n", [nodes()]),
 4283:     io:format("known: ~p~n", [get_known(node()) -- [node()]]),
 4284:     io:format("Info ~p~n", [setelement(10, global:info(), trace)]),
 4285:     _ = [io:format("~s: ~p~n", [TN, ets:tab2list(T)]) ||
 4286:             {TN, T} <- [{"Global Names     (ETS)", global_names},
 4287:                         {"Global Names Ext (ETS)", global_names_ext},
 4288:                         {"Global Locks     (ETS)", global_locks},
 4289:                         {"Global Pid Names (ETS)", global_pid_names},
 4290:                         {"Global Pid Ids   (ETS)", global_pid_ids}]],
 4291:     ?UNTIL([] =:= global:registered_names()),
 4292:     ?UNTIL([] =:= nodes()),
 4293:     ?UNTIL([node()] =:= get_known(node())),
 4294:     ok.
 4295: 
 4296: mk_node(N, H) when is_list(N), is_list(H) ->
 4297:     list_to_atom(N ++ "@" ++ H).
 4298: 
 4299: remove_gg_pub_type([]) ->
 4300:     [];
 4301: remove_gg_pub_type([{GG, Nodes}|Rest]) ->
 4302:     [{GG, Nodes}|remove_gg_pub_type(Rest)];
 4303: remove_gg_pub_type([{GG, _, Nodes}|Rest]) ->
 4304:     [{GG, Nodes}|remove_gg_pub_type(Rest)].
 4305: 
 4306: %% Send garbage message to all processes that are linked to global.
 4307: %% Better do this in a slave node.
 4308: %% (The transition from links to monitors does not affect this case.)
 4309: 
 4310: garbage_messages(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 4311:     Timeout = 25,
 4312:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 4313:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 4314:     init_condition(Config),
 4315:     [Slave] = start_nodes([garbage_messages], slave, Config),
 4316:     Fun = fun() ->
 4317: 		  {links,L} = process_info(whereis(global_name_server), links),
 4318: 		  lists:foreach(fun(Pid) -> Pid ! {garbage,to,you} end, L),
 4319: 		  receive
 4320: 		      _Any -> ok
 4321: 		  end
 4322: 	  end,
 4323:     Pid = spawn_link(Slave, erlang, apply, [Fun,[]]),
 4324:     ct:sleep(2000),
 4325:     Global = rpc:call(Slave, erlang, whereis, [global_name_server]),
 4326:     {registered_name,global_name_server} =
 4327: 	rpc:call(Slave, erlang, process_info, [Global,registered_name]),
 4328:     true = unlink(Pid),
 4329:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 4330:     stop_node(Slave),
 4331:     init_condition(Config),
 4332:     ok.
 4333: 
 4334: %% This is scenario outlined in
 4335: %% https://erlang.org/pipermail/erlang-questions/2020-October/100034.html.
 4336: %% It illustrates that the algorithm of Global is flawed.
 4337: %%
 4338: %% This has been worked around by global actively disconnecting nodes
 4339: %% to prevent overlapping partitions (OTP-17843).
 4340: flaw1(Config) ->
 4341:     case prevent_overlapping_partitions() of
 4342:         true ->
 4343:             flaw1_test(Config);
 4344:         false ->
 4345:             {skipped, "Prevent overlapping partitions disabled"}
 4346:     end.
 4347: 
 4348: flaw1_test(Config) ->
 4349:     Timeout = 360,
 4350:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 4351:     init_high_level_trace(Timeout),
 4352:     init_condition(Config),
 4353:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 4354: 
 4355:     PartCtrlr = start_partition_controller(Config),
 4356: 
 4357:     [A, B, C, D] = OtherNodes = start_nodes([a, b, c, d], peer, Config),
 4358:     Nodes = lists:sort([node() | OtherNodes]),
 4359:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 4360: 
 4361:     F1 =
 4362:         fun(S0) ->
 4363:                 ct:sleep(100),
 4364:                 Str = "************",
 4365:                 S = Str ++ "  " ++ lists:flatten(S0) ++ "  " ++ Str,
 4366:                 io:format("~s\n", [S]),
 4367:                 erpc:call(
 4368:                   PartCtrlr,
 4369:                   fun () ->
 4370:                           [begin
 4371:                                RNs = erpc:call(N, global, registered_names, []),
 4372:                                W = erpc:call(N, global, whereis_name, [x]),
 4373:                                io:format("   === ~w ===\n", [N]),
 4374:                                io:format("       registered names: ~p", [RNs]),
 4375:                                io:format("       where is x:       ~p", [W])
 4376:                            end || N <- OtherNodes]
 4377:                   end)
 4378:         end,
 4379:     F1("start"),
 4380: 
 4381:     disconnect_nodes(PartCtrlr, A, C),
 4382:     F1("after disconnecting c from a"),
 4383: 
 4384:     Me = self(),
 4385:     IdleFun = fun () ->
 4386:                       Mon = erlang:monitor(process, Me),
 4387:                       receive
 4388:                           {'DOWN', Mon, process, Me, _} ->
 4389:                               exit(normal)
 4390:                       end
 4391:               end,
 4392:     Pid = spawn(IdleFun),
 4393:     yes = rpc:call(A, global, register_name, [x, Pid]),
 4394:     F1(io_lib:format("after registering x as ~p on a", [Pid])),
 4395: 
 4396:     disconnect_nodes(PartCtrlr, B, D),
 4397:     F1("after disconnecting d from b"),
 4398: 
 4399:     Pid2 = spawn(IdleFun),
 4400:     yes = rpc:call(B, global, re_register_name, [x, Pid2]),
 4401:     F1(io_lib:format("after re_register_name x as ~p on b", [Pid2])),
 4402: 
 4403:     pong = rpc:call(A, net_adm, ping, [C]),
 4404:     F1("finished after ping c from a"),
 4405: 
 4406:     pong = rpc:call(B, net_adm, ping, [D]),
 4407:     F1("finished after ping d from b"),
 4408: 
 4409:     timer:sleep(1000),
 4410: 
 4411:     check_everywhere(Nodes, x, Config),
 4412:     F1("After check everywhere"),
 4413: 
 4414:     assert_pid(global:whereis_name(x)),
 4415: 
 4416:     lists:foreach(fun(N) ->
 4417: 			  rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, stop_tracer, [])
 4418: 		  end, Nodes),
 4419:     _ = rpc:call(A, global, unregister_name, [x]),
 4420: 
 4421:     F1("after unregistering x on node a"),
 4422: 
 4423:     %% _ = rpc:call(B, global, unregister_name, [y]),
 4424:     %% F1("after unregistering y on node b"),
 4425: 
 4426:     ct:sleep(100),
 4427:     OrigNames = global:registered_names(),
 4428:     write_high_level_trace(Config),
 4429:     stop_nodes(OtherNodes),
 4430:     stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr),
 4431:     init_condition(Config),
 4432:     ok.
 4433: 
 4434: global_disconnect(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 4435:     Timeout = 30,
 4436:     ct:timetrap({seconds,Timeout}),
 4437: 
 4438:     [] = nodes(connected),
 4439: 
 4440:     {ok, H1} = start_hidden_node(h1, Config),
 4441:     {ok, H2} = start_hidden_node(h2, Config),
 4442:     {ok, Cp1} = start_node(cp1, peer, Config),
 4443:     {ok, Cp2} = start_node(cp2, peer, Config),
 4444:     {ok, Cp3} = start_node(cp3, peer, Config),
 4445: 
 4446:     ThisNode = node(),
 4447:     HNodes = lists:sort([H1, H2]),
 4448:     OtherGNodes = lists:sort([Cp1, Cp2, Cp3]),
 4449:     AllGNodes = lists:sort([ThisNode|OtherGNodes]),
 4450: 
 4451:     lists:foreach(fun (Node) -> pong = net_adm:ping(Node) end, OtherGNodes),
 4452: 
 4453:     wait_for_ready_net(Config),
 4454: 
 4455:     ok = erpc:call(
 4456:            H2,
 4457:            fun () ->
 4458:                    lists:foreach(fun (Node) ->
 4459:                                          pong = net_adm:ping(Node)
 4460:                                  end, OtherGNodes)
 4461:            end),
 4462: 
 4463:     lists:foreach(
 4464:       fun (Node) ->
 4465:               AllGNodes = erpc:call(
 4466:                             H1,
 4467:                             fun () ->
 4468:                                     erpc:call(
 4469:                                       Node,
 4470:                                       fun () ->
 4471:                                               lists:sort([node()|nodes()])
 4472:                                       end)
 4473:                             end),
 4474:               HNodes = erpc:call(
 4475:                          H1,
 4476:                          fun () ->
 4477:                                  erpc:call(
 4478:                                    Node,
 4479:                                    fun () ->
 4480:                                            lists:sort(nodes(hidden))
 4481:                                    end)
 4482:                          end)
 4483:       end, AllGNodes),
 4484: 
 4485:     OtherGNodes = lists:sort(global:disconnect()),
 4486: 
 4487:     GNodesAfterDisconnect = nodes(),
 4488: 
 4489:     HNodes = lists:sort(nodes(hidden)),
 4490: 
 4491:     lists:foreach(fun (Node) ->
 4492:                           false = lists:member(Node, GNodesAfterDisconnect)
 4493:                   end,
 4494:                   OtherGNodes),
 4495: 
 4496:     %% Wait a while giving the other nodes time to react to the disconnects
 4497:     %% before we check that everything is as expected...
 4498:     receive after 2000 -> ok end,
 4499: 
 4500:     lists:foreach(
 4501:       fun (Node) ->
 4502:               OtherGNodes = erpc:call(
 4503:                               H1,
 4504:                               fun () ->
 4505:                                       erpc:call(
 4506:                                         Node,
 4507:                                         fun () ->
 4508:                                                 lists:sort([node()|nodes()])
 4509:                                         end)
 4510:                               end),
 4511:               HNodes = erpc:call(
 4512:                          H1,
 4513:                          fun () ->
 4514:                                  erpc:call(
 4515:                                    Node,
 4516:                                    fun () ->
 4517:                                            lists:sort(nodes(hidden))
 4518:                                    end)
 4519:                          end)
 4520:       end, OtherGNodes),
 4521: 
 4522:     stop_node(Cp1),
 4523:     stop_node(Cp2),
 4524:     stop_node(Cp3),
 4525:     stop_node(H1),
 4526:     stop_node(H2),
 4527: 
 4528:     ok.
 4529: 
 4530: %% ---
 4531: 
 4532: wait_for_ready_net(Config) ->
 4533:     {Pid, MRef} = spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 4534:                                         wait_for_ready_net(?NODES, Config)
 4535:                                 end),
 4536:     wait_for_ready_net_loop(Pid, MRef).
 4537: 
 4538: wait_for_ready_net_loop(Pid, MRef) ->
 4539:     receive
 4540:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, Info} ->
 4541:             ?P("wait-for-ready-net process terminated: "
 4542:                "~n      ~p", [Info]),
 4543:             ok;
 4544: 
 4545:         {'EXIT', ParentPid, {timetrap_timeout, _Timeout, _Stack}} ->
 4546:             ?P("wait-for-ready-net -> received timetrap timeout:"
 4547:                "~n   Regarding: ~p"
 4548:                "~n   Waiter:    ~p"
 4549:                "~n      Current Location: ~p"
 4550:                "~n      Dictionary:       ~p"
 4551:                "~n      Messages:          ~p",
 4552:                [ParentPid, Pid,
 4553:                 pi(Pid, current_location),
 4554:                 pi(Pid, dictionary),
 4555:                 pi(Pid, messages)]),
 4556:             exit(Pid, kill),
 4557:             ct:fail("Timeout waiting for ready network")
 4558: 
 4559:     end.
 4560: 
 4561: wait_for_ready_net(Nodes0, Config) ->
 4562:     Nodes = lists:sort(Nodes0),
 4563:     ?P("wait_for_ready_net ->"
 4564:        "~n   Nodes: ~p", [Nodes]),
 4565:     ?UNTIL(begin
 4566:                lists:all(fun(N) ->
 4567:                                  ?P("wait_for_ready_net -> "
 4568:                                     "get known (by global) for ~p", [N]),
 4569:                                  GNs = get_known(N),
 4570:                                  ?P("wait_for_ready_net -> verify same for ~p:"
 4571:                                     "~n   Global Known: ~p"
 4572:                                     "~n   Nodes:        ~p", [N, GNs, Nodes]),
 4573:                                  GRes = Nodes =:= GNs,
 4574:                                  ?P("wait_for_ready_net => ~p", [GRes]),
 4575:                                  GRes
 4576:                          end,
 4577:                          Nodes) and
 4578: 		   lists:all(fun(N) ->
 4579:                                      ?P("wait_for_ready_net -> "
 4580:                                         "get erlang nodes for ~p", [N]),
 4581: 				     case rpc:call(N, erlang, nodes, []) of
 4582:                                          RNs0 when is_list(RNs0) ->
 4583:                                              RNs = lists:sort([N | RNs0]),
 4584:                                              ?P("wait_for_ready_net -> "
 4585:                                                 "verify same for ~p: "
 4586:                                                 "~n   Remote nodes:  ~p"
 4587:                                                 "~n   (Local) Nodes: ~p",
 4588:                                                 [N, RNs, Nodes]),
 4589:                                              ERes = Nodes =:= RNs,
 4590:                                              ?P("wait_for_ready_net => ~p",
 4591:                                                 [ERes]),
 4592:                                              ERes;
 4593:                                          BadRes ->
 4594:                                              ?P("failed get nodes for ~p"
 4595:                                                 "~n      ~p",
 4596:                                                 [N, BadRes]),
 4597:                                              false
 4598:                                      end
 4599: 			     end,
 4600:                              Nodes)
 4601:            end).
 4602: 
 4603: get_known(Node) ->
 4604:     case catch gen_server:call({global_name_server,Node},get_known,infinity) of
 4605:         {'EXIT', _} ->
 4606:             [list, without, nodenames];
 4607:         Known when is_list(Known) -> 
 4608:             lists:sort([Node | Known])
 4609:     end.
 4610: 
 4611: quite_a_few_nodes(Max) ->
 4612:     N = try 
 4613:             ulimit("ulimit -u")
 4614:         catch _:_ ->
 4615: 		ulimit("ulimit -p") % can fail...
 4616:         end,
 4617:     lists:min([(N - 40) div 3, Max]).
 4618: 
 4619: ulimit(Cmd) ->
 4620:     N0 = os:cmd(Cmd),
 4621:     N1 = lists:reverse(N0),
 4622:     N2 = lists:dropwhile(fun($\r) -> true;
 4623: 			    ($\n) -> true;
 4624: 			    (_) -> false
 4625: 			 end, N1),
 4626:     case lists:reverse(N2) of
 4627:         "unlimited" -> 10000;
 4628:         N -> list_to_integer(N)
 4629:     end.
 4630: 
 4631: %% To make it less probable that some low-level problem causes
 4632: %% problems, the receiving node is ping:ed.
 4633: rpc_cast(Node, Module, Function, Args) ->
 4634:     {_,pong,Node}= {node(),net_adm:ping(Node),Node},
 4635:     rpc:cast(Node, Module, Function, Args).
 4636: 
 4637: global_known(Node) ->
 4638:     gen_server:call({global_name_server, Node}, get_known, infinity).
 4639: 
 4640: global_known() ->
 4641:     global_known(node()).
 4642: 
 4643: disconnect(Node) ->
 4644:     erlang:disconnect_node(Node),
 4645:     wait_until(fun () -> not lists:member(Node, global_known()) end),
 4646:     ok.
 4647: 
 4648: disconnect_nodes(HiddenCtrlNode, NodeA, NodeB) ->
 4649:     Nodes = [node()|nodes()],
 4650:     ok = erpc:call(HiddenCtrlNode,
 4651:                    fun () ->
 4652:                            ok = erpc:call(NodeA,
 4653:                                           fun () ->
 4654:                                                   disconnect(NodeB)
 4655:                                           end),
 4656:                            ok = erpc:call(NodeB,
 4657:                                           fun () ->
 4658:                                                   disconnect(NodeA)
 4659:                                           end),
 4660:                            %% Try to ensure 'lost_connection' messages
 4661:                            %% have been handled (see comment in
 4662:                            %% create_partitions)...
 4663:                            lists:foreach(fun (N) ->
 4664:                                                  _ = global_known(N)
 4665:                                          end, Nodes),
 4666:                            ok
 4667:                    end).
 4668: 
 4669: create_partitions(PartitionsList) ->
 4670:     AllNodes = lists:sort(lists:flatten(PartitionsList)),
 4671: 
 4672:     %% Take down all connections on all nodes...
 4673:     AllOk = lists:map(fun (_) -> {ok, ok} end, AllNodes),
 4674:     io:format("Disconnecting all nodes from eachother...", []),
 4675:     AllOk = erpc:multicall(
 4676:               AllNodes,
 4677:               fun () ->
 4678:                       lists:foreach(fun (N) ->
 4679:                                             erlang:disconnect_node(N)
 4680:                                     end, nodes()),
 4681:                       wait_until(fun () -> [] == global_known() end),
 4682:                       ok
 4683:               end, 5000),
 4684:     %% Here we know that all 'lost_connection' messages that will be
 4685:     %% sent by global name servers due to these disconnects have been
 4686:     %% sent, but we don't know that all of them have been received and
 4687:     %% handled. By communicating with all global name servers one more
 4688:     %% time it is very likely that all of them have been received and
 4689:     %% handled (however, not guaranteed). If 'lost_connection' messages
 4690:     %% are received after we begin to set up the partitions, the
 4691:     %% partitions may lose connection with some of its nodes.
 4692:     lists:foreach(fun (N) -> [] = global_known(N) end, AllNodes),
 4693: 
 4694:     %% Set up fully connected partitions...
 4695:     io:format("Connecting partitions...", []),
 4696:     lists:foreach(
 4697:       fun (Partition) ->
 4698:               Part = lists:sort(Partition),
 4699:               PartOk = lists:map(fun (_) -> {ok, ok} end, Part),
 4700:               PartOk = erpc:multicall(
 4701:                          Part,
 4702:                          fun () ->
 4703:                                  wait_until(
 4704:                                    fun () ->
 4705:                                            ConnNodes = Part -- [node()|nodes()],
 4706:                                            if ConnNodes == [] ->
 4707:                                                    true;
 4708:                                               true ->
 4709:                                                    lists:foreach(
 4710:                                                      fun (N) ->
 4711:                                                              net_kernel:connect_node(N)
 4712:                                                      end, ConnNodes),
 4713:                                                    false
 4714:                                            end
 4715:                                    end),
 4716:                                  ok
 4717:                                                         
 4718:                          end, 5000)
 4719:       end, PartitionsList),
 4720:     ok.
 4721:                                                      
 4722: setup_partitions(PartCtrlr, PartList) when is_atom(PartCtrlr) ->
 4723:     ok = erpc:call(PartCtrlr, fun () -> create_partitions(PartList) end),
 4724:     io:format("Partitions successfully setup:~n", []),
 4725:     lists:foreach(fun (Part) ->
 4726:                           io:format("~p~n", [Part])
 4727:                   end,
 4728:                   PartList),
 4729:     ok;
 4730: setup_partitions(Config, PartList) when is_list(Config) ->
 4731:     PartCtrlr = start_partition_controller(Config),
 4732:     setup_partitions(PartCtrlr, PartList),
 4733:     PartCtrlr.
 4734: 
 4735: start_partition_controller(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 4736:     {ok, PartCtrlr} = start_hidden_node(part_ctrlr, Config),
 4737:     PartCtrlr.
 4738: 
 4739: stop_partition_controller(PartCtrlr) ->
 4740:     stop_node(PartCtrlr).
 4741: 
 4742: prevent_overlapping_partitions() ->
 4743:     case application:get_env(kernel, prevent_overlapping_partitions) of
 4744:         {ok, false} ->
 4745:             false;
 4746:         _ ->
 4747:             true
 4748:     end.
 4749: 
 4750: cast_line([]) ->
 4751:     ok;
 4752: cast_line([N|Ns]) when N == node() ->
 4753:     cast_line(Ns);
 4754: cast_line([N|Ns]) ->
 4755:     erpc:cast(N, fun () -> cast_line(Ns) end).
 4756:                          
 4757: wait_until(F) ->
 4758:     case catch F() of
 4759:         true ->
 4760:             ok;
 4761:         _ ->
 4762:             receive after 10 -> ok end,
 4763:             wait_until(F)
 4764:     end.
 4765: 
 4766: 
 4767: %% The emulator now ensures that the node has been removed from
 4768: %% nodes().
 4769: rpc_disconnect_node(Node, DisconnectedNode, Config) ->
 4770:     true = rpc:call(Node, erlang, disconnect_node, [DisconnectedNode]),
 4771:     ?UNTIL
 4772:       (not lists:member(DisconnectedNode, rpc:call(Node, erlang, nodes, []))).
 4773: 
 4774: %%%
 4775: %%% Utility
 4776: %%%
 4777: 
 4778: %% It is a bit awkward to collect data from different nodes. One way
 4779: %% of doing is to use a named tracer process on each node. Interesting
 4780: %% data is banged to the tracer and when the test is finished data is
 4781: %% collected on some node by sending messages to the tracers. One
 4782: %% cannot do this if the net has been set up to be less than fully
 4783: %% connected. One can also prepare other modules, such as 'global', by
 4784: %% inserting lines like
 4785: %%   trace_message({node(), {at,?LINE}, {tag, message})
 4786: %% where appropriate.
 4787: 
 4788: start_tracer() ->
 4789:     Pid = spawn(fun() -> tracer([]) end),
 4790:     case catch register(my_tracer, Pid) of
 4791:         {'EXIT', _} ->
 4792:             ct:fail(re_register_my_tracer);
 4793:         _ ->
 4794:             ok
 4795:     end.
 4796: 
 4797: tracer(L) ->
 4798:     receive 
 4799:         %% {save, Term} ->
 4800:         %%     tracer([{erlang:timestamp(),Term} | L]);
 4801:         {get, From} ->
 4802:             From ! {trace, lists:reverse(L)},
 4803:             tracer([]);
 4804:         stop ->
 4805:             exit(normal);
 4806:         Term ->
 4807:             tracer([{erlang:timestamp(),Term} | L])
 4808:     end.
 4809: 
 4810: stop_tracer() ->
 4811:     trace_message(stop).
 4812: 
 4813: get_trace() ->
 4814:     trace_message({get, self()}),
 4815:     receive {trace, L} ->
 4816:             L
 4817:     end.
 4818: 
 4819: collect_tracers(Nodes) ->
 4820:     Traces0 = [rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, get_trace, []) || N <- Nodes],
 4821:     Traces = [L || L <- Traces0, is_list(L)],
 4822:     try begin 
 4823:             Stamped = lists:keysort(1, lists:append(Traces)),
 4824:             NotStamped = [T || {_, T} <- Stamped],
 4825:             {Stamped, NotStamped}
 4826:         end
 4827:     catch _:_ -> {[], []}
 4828:     end.
 4829: 
 4830: trace_message(M) ->
 4831:     case catch my_tracer ! M of
 4832:         {'EXIT', _} ->
 4833:             ct:fail(my_tracer_not_registered);
 4834:         _ ->
 4835:             ok
 4836:     end.
 4837: 
 4838: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 4839: 
 4840: pi(Item) ->
 4841:     pi(self(), Item).
 4842: pi(Pid, Item) ->
 4843:     {Item, Val} = process_info(Pid, Item),
 4844:     Val.
 4845:     
 4846: 
 4847: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 4848: 
 4849: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 4850: %% The error_logger handler used for OTP-6931.
 4851: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 4852: init(Tester) ->
 4853:     {ok, Tester}.
 4854: 
 4855: handle_event({_, _GL, {_Pid,_String,[{nodeup,fake_node,_}=Msg]}}, Tester) ->
 4856:     Tester ! Msg,
 4857:     {ok, Tester};
 4858: handle_event(_Event, State) ->
 4859:     {ok, State}.
 4860: 
 4861: handle_info(_Info, State) ->
 4862:     {ok, State}.
 4863: 
 4864: handle_call(_Query, State) -> {ok, {error, bad_query}, State}.
 4865: 
 4866: terminate(_Reason, State) ->
 4867:     State.
 4868: 
 4869: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 4870: %%%
 4871: %%% Keep track of started nodes so we can kill them if test
 4872: %%% cases fail to stop them. This typically happens on test case
 4873: %%% failure with peer nodes, and if left might mess up following
 4874: %%% test-cases.
 4875: %%%
 4876: %%% This can be removed when the suite is converted to use CT_PEER.
 4877: %%% This can however at earliest be made in OTP 25.
 4878: %%%
 4879: 
 4880: node_started(Node) ->
 4881:     _ = global_SUITE_node_tracker ! {node_started, Node},
 4882:     ok.
 4883: 
 4884: node_stopped(Node) ->
 4885:     _ = global_SUITE_node_tracker ! {node_stopped, Node},
 4886:     ok.
 4887: 
 4888: start_node_tracker(Config) ->
 4889:     case whereis(global_SUITE_node_tracker) of
 4890:         undefined ->
 4891:             ok;
 4892:         _ ->
 4893:             try
 4894:                 stop_node_tracker(Config),
 4895:                 ok
 4896:             catch
 4897:                 _:_ ->
 4898:                     ok
 4899:             end
 4900:     end,
 4901:     _ = spawn(fun () ->
 4902:                       _ = register(global_SUITE_node_tracker, self()),
 4903:                       node_tracker_loop(#{})
 4904:               end),
 4905:     ok.
 4906: 
 4907: node_tracker_loop(Nodes) ->
 4908:     receive
 4909:         {node_started, Node} ->
 4910:             node_tracker_loop(Nodes#{Node => alive});
 4911:         {node_stopped, Node} ->
 4912:             node_tracker_loop(Nodes#{Node => stopped});
 4913:         stop ->
 4914:             Fact = try 
 4915:                        test_server:timetrap_scale_factor()
 4916:                    catch _:_ -> 1
 4917:                    end,
 4918:             Tmo = 1000*Fact,
 4919:             lists:foreach(
 4920:               fun (N) ->
 4921:                       case maps:get(N, Nodes) of
 4922:                           stopped ->
 4923:                               ok;
 4924:                           alive ->
 4925:                               ct:pal("WARNING: The node ~p was not "
 4926:                                      "stopped by the test case!", [N])
 4927:                       end,
 4928:                       %% We try to kill every node, even those reported as
 4929:                       %% stopped since they might have failed at stopping...
 4930:                       case rpc:call(N, erlang, halt, [], Tmo) of
 4931:                           {badrpc,nodedown} ->
 4932:                               ok;
 4933:                           {badrpc,timeout} ->
 4934:                               ct:pal("WARNING: Failed to kill node: ~p~n"
 4935:                                      "         Disconnecting it, but it may "
 4936:                                      "still be alive!", [N]),
 4937:                               erlang:disconnect_node(N),
 4938:                               ok;
 4939:                           Unexpected ->
 4940:                               ct:pal("WARNING: Failed to kill node: ~p~n"
 4941:                                      "         Got response: ~p~n"
 4942:                                      "         Disconnecting it, but it may "
 4943:                                      "still be alive!", [N, Unexpected]),
 4944:                               erlang:disconnect_node(N),
 4945:                               ok
 4946:                       end
 4947:               end, maps:keys(Nodes))
 4948:     end.
 4949: 
 4950: stop_node_tracker(Config) ->
 4951:     NTRes = case whereis(global_SUITE_node_tracker) of
 4952:                 undefined ->
 4953:                     {fail, missing_node_tracker};
 4954:                 NT when is_port(NT) ->
 4955:                     NTMon = erlang:monitor(port, NT),
 4956:                     exit(NT, kill),
 4957:                     receive {'DOWN', NT, port, NT, _} -> ok end,
 4958:                     {fail, {port_node_tracker, NT}};
 4959:                 NT when is_pid(NT) ->
 4960:                     NTMon = erlang:monitor(process, NT),
 4961:                     NT ! stop,
 4962:                     receive
 4963:                         {'DOWN', NTMon, process, NT, normal} ->
 4964:                             ok;
 4965:                         {'DOWN', NTMon, process, NT, Reason} ->
 4966:                             {fail, {node_tracker_failed, Reason}}
 4967:                     end
 4968:             end,
 4969:     case NTRes of
 4970:         ok ->
 4971:             ok;
 4972:         NTFailure ->
 4973:             case proplists:get_value(tc_status, Config) of
 4974:                 ok ->
 4975:                     %% Fail test case with info about node tracker...
 4976:                     NTFailure;
 4977:                 _ ->
 4978:                     %% Don't fail due to node tracker...
 4979:                     ct:pal("WARNING: Node tracker failure: ~p", [NTFailure]),
 4980:                     ok
 4981:             end
 4982:     end.
